loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Kumuru B Group

texts.en:
This group of three people is a Nuru International group of farmers called Kumuru B. The group is based in Kuria West District. They have come together in order to grow, socially and economically, through agriculture.

Baraka is 24 years old and married, and he has two children. One of the children goes to school. He is a first-time member of the group. He is very excited about joining the group. He believes this will provide a good platform for him to learn better farming methods that will increase his harvest significantly.
 
Baraka will grow sorghum, millet and maize, in a one acre farm, during the 2014 long rains. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Kiva.  He will buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer with the loan, which is expected to enable him to have a bountiful harvest during the 2014 harvest period. He will secure food for his family and sell the surplus. He will use the money he earns to pay back the loan and to invest in another business.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for growing maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is from Getafe, Bohol. She is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. Together with her husband, she has been in the fishing business to support her family. With her husband's catch, she helps sell in the community.  

Alma is requesting a loan to buy fish net and fuel, and pay for repair and maintenance. The loan would allow her husband to better his tools and assure him of daily fishing activity. 

In the future, Alma dreams of expanding their business and is hoping to have another means of making a business so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fish net and fuel, and pay for repair and maintenance

loans.name: Menuka

texts.en:
Menuka is 40 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 18 and 13.   

Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Menuka plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
 
In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called “pasal”, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Keyvin Omar

texts.es:
Keyvin, necesita un nuevo crédito para solventar su necesidad de comprar herbicidas, plaguicidas, abono y semilla, para sembrar, con lo que espera tener una buena cosecha y continuar mejorando su economía.
El préstamo anterior lo utilizo para efectuar la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios para el cultivo teniendo como resultado una cosecha abundante y de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Keyvin needs a new loan to buy necessities: herbicides, pesticides, fertilizer, and seed to plant.  He hopes to have a good harvest and continue improving his economy.  

He used his prior loan to buy agricultural supplies he needed for his crop, which resulted in an abundant, higher quality harvest.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides, fertilizer, and seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, timber beams and and rafters made of pine, as well as nails to repair the roof to her home.

loans.name: Mujeres Bonitas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Bonitas es un grupo nuevo, que está en su primer ciclo del programa de comités, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias, una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariana, quien se destaca por el entusiasmo que tiene, ya que se ha propuesto dar su mayor esfuerzo para crecer y mejorar.
Ella se dedica a la venta de plantas, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de árboles frutales para la venta, y también de abono, ya que son los que más pedidos tiene. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Mujeres Bonitas is a new group and is on its first committee program. They are women who are the heads of their households and who have united to help their families.

One of the members is Mariana, who is well-known for her enthusiasm, since she has always given her best effort to grow and improve. She makes a living by selling plants and she requests this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of fruit trees to sell, and also manure. She has the most orders for these things. She is grateful for this opportunity that she has received to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fruit trees to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement. sand, pine struts and pay for labor to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia Beatriz se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de autopartes,la socia tambien se dedica a su trabajo como docente,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,y en las tardes se dedica al negocio de venta de autopartes,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de autopartes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar autopartes.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member Beatriz continues her business of buying and selling replacement parts for cars. She also works as a teacher. Her working hours in the classroom are from 8:00 am until 1:00 pm. Then in the afternoons she pursues her auto parts business. Beatriz has been in this business for various years.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more auto parts to sell. Her dream is to expand her auto parts business. 

Beatriz promises to comply with her schedule of payments.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts to sell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas se sigue dedicando al negocio de ferreteria,la socia vende clavos,pinturas y herramientas,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar clavos,pinturas y herramientas.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Felicitas continues with her hardware business. This member has been selling nails, paint and tools for several years now. She wants to get ahead through her business. Her dream is to expand the business.

Felicitas is requesting a loan to buy nails, paint and tools. She is happy with the loan and promises to pay the installments in the agreed time frame.

loans.use: to buy nails, paints and tools.

loans.name: Dioceline

texts.en:
Dioceline is 50 years old and married with ten children.

Dioceline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Dioceline has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from fish vending and raising livestock.

Dioceline aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell native mats business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional natives mats to sell to her customers through her buy-and-sell native mats business.

Susan has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from raising livestock.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional natives mats to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alinyikira  Dev't Group

texts.en: Amina is grateful to the Kiva lenders through Ugafode for a job well done. She was able to increase her stock of stoves and increase her sales. She now wants another loan since the previous one was paid off. She will be able to get a discount if she buys in large quantities. This will help her to earn increased profit. She is hard working and thanks Kiva lenders for being supportive.Two of the members are sitting out this loan cycle though they have signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy local charcoal stoves for sell

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 22-year-old, energetic married woman. For the last three years, she has been manufacturing "waan," which is a material used in making charpoy (a bedstand of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and she has become famous for providing good quality waan in her community. 

Shakeela operates the machine at home with the help of her husband for the sake of their family. She is trying hard to fulfill the needs of her family members; this requires improving her business. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation to buy another waan making machine.  This will help produce good quality thread to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy another waan making machine.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 24-year-old, married woman and the mother of one child. She has been doing a business of selling milk for the past five years. She sells it to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. Nasreen has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is Nasreen's fourth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through the support of it. Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a married woman and the mother of one child. For the past five years, she has been doing a business of selling milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors. She has become famous in her area for providing good-quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

She requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Doeu

texts.en: Doeu is 27 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving for more than three years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture with her son, is a construction worker who makes an income of USD 8 each day. To improve her family’s finance, Doeu is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she wants to build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela vive con su mama en anticretico, en la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz; de profesión secretaria ejecutiva, no tiene hijos, esta soltera.

Actualmente trabaja en una farmacia como empleada, el crédito que solicita es para pagar los gastos médicos de su madre ya que no cuenta con seguro medico, ella como hija menor se hace cargo de la mantencion de su madre, con su sueldo aunque no es mucho ella se mantiene y mantiene a su familia y cubre sus mínimas necesidades.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la segunda vez en KIVA.
texts.en:
Gabriela lives with her mother in anticretico (a rental arrangement in which a lump sum is paid for housing and then repaid to the tenant at the end of the lease), in the Tembladerani neighborhood in the city of La Paz.  

She is single, she does not have children, and by profession she is an executive secretary. Currently she works in a pharmacy.  The loan that she is seeking is to pay for her mother’s medical expenses, as she does not have health insurance.  As the youngest daughter she has taken on the responsibility for her mother’s support, and with her salary, although it is not much, she supports herself and her family, covering their basic necessities.

This is the second time that she is seeking a loan with IMPRO and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for  the medical expenses of her mother who does not have health insurance.

loans.name: Dúo Salmos 91 Group

texts.es:
DUO SALMOS 91
LA SEÑORA Florencia de 53 años de edad, tiene 2 hojos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas ya tiene algunos años que se dedica a la tortilleria y le ha ido muy bien,  doña florencia a luchado mucho y con la ayuda de DIOS a sacado adelante a sus hijos ella lucha día con día para poder brindarle un buen estilo de vida a su hijos y dentro de los sueños y meta es que su negocio siga prosperando por eso que ella toca las puertas de KIVA ya que desea comprar una estufa mas grande y una plancha para elaborar tortillas, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado
texts.en:
Duo Salmos 91 (Psalms 91 Group)

Florencia is 53 years old and she has two children.  She works selling tortillas.  She has been working at making tortillas for some years now and it has gone very well for her.  Florencia has struggled a lot and with the help of God she has gotten ahead with her children.  She struggles every day to be able to provide a good lifestyle for her children and among her dreams and goals is that her business continue to prosper.  This is the reason she is knocking on Kiva’s doors; she wants to buy a bigger stove and a griddle to make tortillas hoping that Kiva lenders can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy a stove and a griddle (comal) to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stones, cement, sand and iron to build her home's perimeter wall.

loans.name: Karla Jesennia

texts.es:
La señora Karla, labora como conserje en una casa particular, es madre de dos hijos que estudian la escuela secundaria, su esposo trabaja como taxista. 

Karla, está requiriendo construir el área de cocina en su casa de habitación, solicita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para empezar una primera etapa de esta obra tan importante tanto como para ella y su familia, lo que viene a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Karla works as a custodian in a private house. She is the mother of two children who study in High School. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Karla needs to build a kitchen for her home. So she is requesting a loan to buy the construction materials to start the first stage of this project which is so important to her family. It will improve their living situation.

loans.use: to build a kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Ndama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 membre fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 22 octobre 2012. Il est composé des membres qui vivent dans le même village. Les membres se connaissent et vivent dans la bonne entente. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Eugué, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 05 garçons. Sa principale activité est le commerce de légumes. Elle achète pour 20 000 F de légumes qu'elle doit écouler durant toute la semaine. Elle réalise ainsi un bénéfice de 7000 à 10 000 F par semaine. Elle refait le même processus toutes les semaines après écoulement de son stock.
Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle souhaite ouvrir une échoppe.
texts.en:
This group of 22 people is part of the banc villageois that was established on 22 October 2012. Its members live in the same village, and they know each other and get along well. Their main activity is commerce.

Eugué, standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 40 years old. She is married and a mother of eight children, five of whom are boys. 

Eugué sells vegetables. She buys 20,000 francs worth of vegetables that must be resold during the week. This business generates a profit of 7,000-10,000 francs each week. She repeats this process every week after she sells all her stock.

With the earnings she makes, she would like to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Salma

texts.fr: Salma est une femme très dynamique. Elle est divorcé âgée de 43 ans et mère de 3 filles. Exemplaire dans son groupe de solidarité et de nature très rigoureuse et dévouée dans les réunions de Banc Villageois, Salma s’active dans le commerce d’articles divers, de produits locaux tissus, chaussures, bijoux sacs à main. Elle a démarré son activité depuis qu’elle a divorcé en 2005, Salma s’est investie dans le commerce et capitalise une bonne expérience. Avec ses bénéfices elle va épargner au niveau du Banc Villageois, gère sa famille, assure la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants, appui sa maman dans la gestion de la famille, renforce ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Salma is a very dynamic woman. She is divorced, 43 years old, and a mother of three girls. An example in her business group, she is very careful and devoted to the banc villageois and its meetings. 

Salma sells various goods, local fabrics, shoes, jewelry, handbags. She started this business after her divorce in 2005. Salma is invested in her business and does well.

With her earnings, she is going to save money in the banc villageois, take care of her family, ensure the schooling and health of her children, support her mother in the management of the family, and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr: Créé le 05 Décembre 2007 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de 27 femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, l'artisanat. Madame Ndatté (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 45 ans et mère de 05 enfants dont 1 fille et 04 garçon. Elle achète du poison au marché et revend sur place. Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter chaque jour une valeur de 75000 CFA ou 50000F CFA de poissons et revend aux petites commerçantes qui à leur tour revendent dans leurs quartiers. Les bénéfices, elle compte les utiliser pour appuyer son mari dans la scolarisation de ses enfants d’une part et d’autre part à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille aussi renforcer son épargne dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
Created on 5 December 2007 during the inauguration of the banc villageois, this group is made up of 27 women who have experience in the banc villageois system. These women are all from the same area and share strong ties and support each other. They mostly engage in commerce and artisanal work.

Ndatté (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married, 45 years old, and a mother of five children, one girl and four boys. She buys fish at the market and resells them. 

With this new loan, she plans to buy 50,000-75,000 francs CFA worth of fish each day, which she will resell to smaller merchants who then sell them in their areas.

She plans to use part of her earnings to support her husband in the schooling of their children and the other part to improve her family's living conditions and increase her savings in the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Vebiane

texts.en: Vebiane is a woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has seven young children. She is engaged in a hog raising business. She has been raising pigs for almost five years. She applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed and supplements for the pigs to grow healthy in time for sale. Her husband helps sustain the family's expenses by engaging in tuba (coconut wine) vending. In the future, Vebiane would like to expand her pig-raising business to provide her family with proper food and to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements for her pigs.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Socheat is 31 years old, married and a lovely father of three children. Socheat has been in the fishing business for nearly ten years. The caught fish is sold into the local markets by his wife. Together, they are able to earn a suitable income to cover the family’s needs.

This will be Socheat's first loan, which he will use to buy a motorcycle for personal purposes. With the motorcycle, Socheat can facilitate them in their travelling needs, and it also can be used for providing a taxi service to earn more income. 

He is doing great and still working hard to satisfy his daily living needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal purposes.

loans.name: Sovei

texts.en:
Sovei and her family live in the rural village of Siem Reap, which is well-known for its ancient temples, especially Angkor Wat. She has a large family that is comprised of eight members, including her and her husband. In her family, two of her children are employed and the other four still depend on her income.

Sovei is engaged in farming, primarily growing rice on her own land. As the income from farming is barely enough to cover daily costs, Sovei wants to earn through another business opportunity, by selling grocery products to supplement her income. Due to inadequate capital, Sovei is asking for a loan in the sum of USD 1,500 to prepare a grocery store and buy different kinds of products, such as sweets, snacks, cigarettes, drinks, food ingredients, and other household products to resell from her home. 

Thanks to her hard work and loan support, which will allow her to go ahead with her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to prepare a grocery store and buy products, such as sweets, snacks, cigarettes, drinks, food ingredients, and other household products to resell.

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany is a 35-year-old married woman and lives in a  small village of Ruessei Kaev district, Phnom Penh. She earns a living by selling beef soup, soft drink and coffees in her community. From the current business, she is able to make approximately $8.00 per day. Dany has four children, some of whom assist her in her current business besides their classes.

To help her continue her current business in a sustainable way, Dany will use this loan amount to buy more ingredients, drinks and coffees for her store. She hopes that this investment may result in the increase of income, so she can satisfy her basic living needs.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, drinks and coffees for her store.

loans.name: Sonny

texts.en:
Sonny has been a hog-raiser for two years.Aside from his hog-raising business, he also manages family farmland. He works hard to give his family a better life.

This time, Sonny needs additional capital to improve his hog-raising business.For this reason,he is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs. He hopes that he can obtain his desired loan to improve his business and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for different products, such as peppers, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products for her repacking business.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is married with two children. He manages his motorcycle transport services in his community to make a living. He has been doing this for six years, earning well for the needs of the family.

He joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy motor spare parts and accessories for improvement of his services. He is hopeful to become successful in his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy motor spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
This is Agustina. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase plastics and other recyclable materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving funds and use it to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Agustina dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that all her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap and recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 26 years old and married, and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Janet has a food vending business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business like spices, vinegar, cooking oil, etc.

Janet has been in this business for two years. In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business like spices, vinegar, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Nesil

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Nesil works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Nesil is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Nesil has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Edvard

texts.en:
Edvard is 34 years old and lives in the village of Khashtarak in Tavush region. He is married and has two school-aged children. He lives with his parents, who are already retired. Edvard’s wife does not work, and she takes care of their house and children. 

For several years, Edvard used to do passenger transport on a bus. Now he has a minibus of his own and on it he transports his passengers around his region. At the same time, he and his wife are seriously engaged in farming and agriculture. On their farm they have two cows, a calf, a piglet and twenty chickens. They work very hard, and they sell from their farm meat, milk, different dairy products, eggs, and some fruits such as persimmons, apples, etc.

Edvard asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy piglets and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy piglets and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 29 years old and married with four children.

Catherine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items, such as tissues, canned goods, sugar, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. to resell.

Catherine has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Catherine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as tissues, canned goods, sugar, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 45-years-old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Leonida works very hard to provide for them. We can see in the picture her daughter and her two grandchildren.

Leonida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Leonida has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, laundry soap, biscuits, vinegar, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Leonida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna is 33 years old and she lives in Kapan city, in Syunik region. She has graduated from medical college, but she has never worked in her specialty. She got married and, for several years, she did nothing, but take care of her children. 

Now, they are already school-aged and Syuzanna, with her husband, has a business. They rent a stall at the city wholesale market, where Syuzanna sells various products, such as towels, covers for beds, children's clothes, hats and gloves, and also a great range of utensils. Like many other trading business owners, Syuzanna and her husband hope that, with the coming of Christmas and New Year’s holidays, they can have good sales and a decent income.

So, Syuzanna asks for a loan of USD 1,550 (US dollars) to buy new products for her stall (e.g., new, stylish utensils and children's clothes).

loans.use: to buy new products for her stall (e.g., new, stylish utensils and children's clothes).

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora works hard to support her family. Nicanora is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional linen, threads, etc.

Nicanora has been in this business for 42 years now.

In the future, Nicanora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional linen, threads, etc

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 28 years old and lives in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. She is married and has a daughter. She has graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical University. Now she works at the school as a teacher of elementary grades. She says that she feels a great responsibility while teaching such small children, who are interested in everything; they are full of energy and have a great desire to discover more and more. Each child demands care and an individual approach requiring personal touches that are different and various. She also gives paid private courses, working with children who have difficulties understanding some subjects.
Regina asks for a loan of 260,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer that would help her become aware of any changes and innovations in teaching programs of elementary grades.

loans.use: to buy a computer to help her become aware of any changes and innovations in teaching programs of elementary grades

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: Gevorg is 20 years old and lives in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. He lives with his father and sister. He also has two brothers who are married and live with their families. Several years ago Gevorg and his siblings suffered a great and irrecoverable loss when their mother died. Up to now, for the whole family, it has been unbelievably difficult to cope with this reality. Gevorg’s father feels doubly responsible for his children and he is doubly attentive towards them. He works at the car service center, where he repairs and changes car tires. Gevorg also works and with his father they take good care of his school-aged sister. Gevorg asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams to buy a computer as a gift for his sister.

loans.use: to buy a computer as a gift for his sister

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tricycad transport business in the Philippines. Joan has been in this business for three years now.

Joan requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycad transport. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycad transport

loans.name: Hrayr

texts.en:
Hrayr lives in Vanadzor city, in Lori region. He is 45 years old and he lives with his wife and his five-year-old son. His wife does not work and she takes care of their son. 

Hrayr works at the confectionery workshop, as a driver-distributor. He has been doing this work for five years already and, during these years, he managed to have a long list of shops that always give big orders of candies and sweets. 

Hrayr asks for a loan of AMD 500,000 (Armenian drams) in order to buy new products (e.g., a large assortment of tomato paste and mayonnaise) to offer to the shops with which he works and, in this way, to make his family income bigger.

loans.use: to buy new products (e.g., a large assortment of tomato paste and mayonnaise) to offer to the shops with which he works.

loans.name: Aghunik

texts.en:
Aghunik is 48 years old and she lives in Stepanavan city, in Lori region. She is married and she has a son and a daughter. Her daughter is married and she lives with her family, separately. Her son works in the military sphere. Aghunik works as a cook. Together with her son, they earn their living and they also try to do some saving. Aghinik’s son has a nice girlfriend and they are going to get engaged.

So, Aghunik needs a loan in an amount of AMD 250,000 (Armenian drams) in order to pay for some expenses connected with an engagement party (e.g., to buy presents for her son and his bride-to-be).

loans.use: to pay for some expenses connected with an engagement party (e.g., to buy presents for her son and his bride-to-be).

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is 55 years old, and he lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He is married and has two daughters. 

Seyran for several years has been engaged in a fruit and vegetable trading business. He already has paid back his first Kiva loan, which supported him to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale. The income from it helped him to repair his house and improve his family’s living conditions. 

Seyran sells at his stall apples of different sorts, lemons, grapes and pomegranates. The fruits and vegetables for sale he brings once a week from villages in the Ararat region.

Seyran asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy an assortment of citrus fruits for the coming holiday’s sale.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of citrus fruits for the coming holiday’s sale.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu owns a food and drinks business (local restaurant where she serves mainly cooked rice and soft drinks).  She began her business when her salary was not enough to assist her husband with home expenses. She decided to set up her own business to earn more money. Her business is located in the city center. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Musu used profit from her last loan to support her family, pay fees for her children and pay for medical care for her family. Musu now needs a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy rice, palm oil and vegetable oil for her business. She hopes that this loan will increase her monthly profit by 300,000 SLL. In the future, Musu plans to complete her house with additional support from her husband. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: in order to buy rice, palm oil and vegetable oil for her business.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 40 years old and she is a single woman. She is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business.  She opened her sewing service in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some items to keep in her store such as a sewing machine, thread, tables chairs, and scissors. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future. And she is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve living conditions for the future. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, tables, chairs and scissors

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three determined entrepreneurial women. One of them is Florence who is 44 years old and is married. For 10 years she has had a business selling vegetables. She needs the loan to buy tomatoes, onions, shallots, garden eggs and peppers.

The other members are:
Berlinda (30) who sells wax-prints and Margaret (33) who sells cosmetics, they need a total amount of GHS 1900 to group their businesses.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, shallots, garden eggs and peppers.

loans.name: Shahmeem

texts.en:
Shahmeem is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. 

She has been doing it for 20 years, and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she requested Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase one more buffalo. This will help her increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her sixth loan cycle.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business.  She is married and she has three children.  She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family.  She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as oils, fish, milk, bread, slippers, coffee, sugar, and salt.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 300.  Elsa is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oils, fish, milk, bread, slippers, coffee, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Edgar De Jesús

texts.es:
Edgar es un campesino de 35 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Desde muy joven aprendió de su padre a realizar todas las labores del campo y, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de café, caña de azúcar, tomate de aliños y plátano; cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en la plaza de mercado del pueblo donde reside; de esta manera ha generado los recursos económicos suficientes para llevar el alimento y el sustento a su familia.
A pesar de los desafíos que se presentan en el campo agrícola, debido a los altos costos de los insumos y a la inestabilidad de los precios de venta de los productos que han generado crisis en el sector, él ha logrado salir adelante con su perseverancia, empuje y espíritu de superación.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar diversos productos para el cuidado de sus cultivos como abonos, pesticidas, fungicidas, entre otros; así estará en la capacidad de obtener una mejor producción y poder tener un mayor nivel de utilidades a la hora de vender el producto.
Edgar sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, por lo que requiere seguir luchando para ampliar sus cultivos y tener una mayor producción para garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita brindar educación de calidad a sus hijos y un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Edgar is a 35 year old farmer, father of three children who he has raised with a lot of effort. Since he was young he was taught about working the land by his father. Thanks to this today he has crops of coffee, sugar cane, tomatoes and bananas, He takes his harvest to sell in the market of the community where he lives. In this way he can generate the resources he needs to pay for food and sustenance for his family.

In spite of the challenges he faces in the agricultural world, due to the high cost of inputs and the instability of prices for his produce which have produced a crisis in the sector, he has managed to get on with perseverance, drive and the desire to succeed.

The loan he is requesting is to buy various products to protect his crops like fertilizer, insecticides, fungicides etc. This will enable him to obtain better production and get a higher level of profit when he goes to sell.

Edgar dreams of strengthening his business, so he has to struggle to expand his plantings and increase his production to guarantee economic stability. Which would allow him to give his children better education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, fungicides, etc.

loans.name: Komisah

texts.en:
Komisah runs a small stall, which sells medicine and mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments. Komisah lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area three hours from Jakarta. Komisah is married and has children.

Komisah began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

For the last month, she has had around $30 - $40 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, she took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to pay for a printer that is used for mobile phone airtime credit and bill payment transactions support

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and tools to tend to her squash plants.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 48-year-old mother of four. She has been raising sheep and working to ensure a steady income. This is the time to begin increasing her stock, taking care of her animals and preparing for the springtime when she is expecting increased customer demand.

She needed this loan to purchase 15 additional sheep, buy medicine, food, water and to pay for transporting supplies.

Samar is proud of what she has accomplished so far and understands how to manage her business and prepare for opportunities as well as difficult seasons. She wants to continue increasing her stock. She hopes one day to have a full herd.

loans.use: To purchase additional sheep and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es: Manuel de 35 años de Edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y han procreado un hijo. Manuel se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras, además trabaja muy bien la carpintería. Manuel tiene la necesidad de proteger el terreno de su vivienda por lo que necesita urgentemente la construcción de un muro de retención. Por esa razón ha solicitado a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en la compra de piedra cuarta, cemento, grava, arena y hierro para la construcción del muro. Manuel menciona que solventará puntualmente las cuotas que este crédito implica
texts.en: Manuel, 35, lives with his life partner and they have a son. Manuel makes his living buying and selling vegetables, he also works wood very well. Manuel needs to protect his piece of land belonging to his home which is why he urgently needs to build a retaining wall. It is for this reason that he has sought a loan from FUSAI to buy aggregates, gravel, sand and iron to build the wall. Manuel says that he will meet the repayments that this loan implies on time.

loans.use: to buy aggregates, cemento, gravel, sand and iron to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por otro crédito para invertir en la compra de lociones, cremas, cosméticos y materia prima para las pupusas tales como quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, aderezos, etc., para surtir el negocio, continuar aumentando sus ventas y tener más clientes satisfechos.
María invirtió el préstamo anterior en la compra de ingredientes para la pupuseria y productos de belleza, con lo que cubrió las necesidades de sus clientes y mejoro su economía, permitiéndole ofrecer un mejor de estilo de de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María has decided to take out another loan to invest in lotions, creams, cosmetics, and supplies (such as tortillas with cream cheese filling, pork, oil and dressing) for making "pupusas" (a tortilla stuffed with cheese, beans, and meats). With this loan she can stock up her business, continue to increase sales, and have more satisfied customers.

María invested her previous loan in ingredients for her "pupusa" stall, and in beauty products. With these items she was able to fulfil her customers' needs and improve her own financial situation. This allowed her to offer her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, cosmetics, and supplies for making "pupusas"

loans.name: Esther De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Esther es habitante de una comarca cercana a la capital de Managua, en donde habita junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos quienes ya son independientes, pero aun viven con sus padres.

Esther labora como operaria de costura. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y empezar la obra de un cuarto para alquiler, con esto desea mejorar sus ingresos, puesto que la canasta básica cada vez es más cara y desea crear una fuente extra de ingresos para poder ir mejorando su vida poco a poco.
texts.en:
Esther is an inhabitant of a rural area of a municipality near to the capital, Managua, where she lives with her husband and their three children who are already adults but still live with their parents.

Esther works as a seamstress. She is seeking a loan to buy construction materials and start to build a room for rent, it is with this room that she hopes to improve her income given that the food basket is ever more expensive and she wants to create an additional source of income to continue improving her life little by little.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make a room.

loans.name: Talanesu-1 Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu, 36, was born in Waterloo, in western Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Isatu sells market food: onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, etc.

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy onions, margi, tomatoes, etc. in a large quantity to add to her current stock for sale.

loans.use: to buy onions, margi, tomatoes, etc. in a large quantity to add to her current stock for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes and shoes to add to her current stock for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of palm oil, salt, and other goods to add to his current stock

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. In 2009, and after couple of years working as a carpenter, he decided to open a carpentry business and hired a part-time worker to get the work done more rapidly. With his youth loan requested form Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Mohamad will acquire a large quantity of wood to be able to proceed with finishing his projects properly. Mohamad is very happy and satisfied with what he has attained so far, but the lack of financials at this stage is keeping him away from reaching what he is intending for; so help him out so that he can meet his needs and requirements.

loans.use: to acquire a large quantity of wood

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Domingga joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Her transportation business was successful. She used her previous loan to repair her existing vehicle and provide better service.  She successfully repaid that loan.

Recently, she took out a new loan to buy grocery goods to resell, as she had a retail business aside from transportation to gain additional income for the family.  

She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 52-years-old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marialyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marialyn has been farming rice for 25 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Saturnina has been in this business for one year now.

Saturnina requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 45 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Anahit asking for second loan from Kiva. She is running a clothes-trading business at a rented stall in the city's wholesale market. She has a lot of regular customers. The first loan helped her to buy an assortment of autumn clothes to resell, which she sold successfully and received decent income. With the coming of the winter cold season she wants to sell jackets and coats for women and men.
She asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy festive dresses and clothes for women and men in time for the holidays when she is sure she will have good sales.

loans.use: to buy festive dresses and clothes for women and men in time for the holidays when she is sure to have good sales

loans.name: Sanraksa

texts.en:
Sanraksa, aged 31, is living in a rural village of the Toul Kok district and has two dependent children. He is an English tutor in the village. Engaging in this job for five years, he can earn around US $8 per day from his current job.
 
This is for a microloan for Sanraksa with Kiva partner, VisionFund. He is applying for a loan to pay for his university tuition to study English literature. He hopes this loan will keep him in university until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for him to study English literature

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Sokhen, 34, is a married mother living with her family in a village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has two children. For the last 16 years, Sokhen has been washing and drying clothes while her husband sells coffee and soft drinks. Together, they can earn about US $9 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sokhen has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The past loans, which she successfully repaid, have helped her support her family with sufficient food. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Sokhen will use this loan to buy more coffee and soft drinks to resell and use a portion of it to buy washing supplies for her laundry business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Sreyngorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sreyngorn is 24 years old and married with one child. She and her husband earn a living through working as construction workers. 

Having been in this business for six years, she is able to earn about KHR23,000 per day and manages to save about KHR11,00 each day for future needs. 

Sreyngorn is the first cycled client with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy construction materials for supporting her current business. She hopes to make a living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for supporting her current business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is 56 years old and has five children, two sons and three daughters. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Cuc has been running a general store in front of her door for 18 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. 

Cuc is requesting a loan to stock her stall and expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy household items and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is 42 years old and is married. She and her husband earn a living raising cows and planting vegetables to sell. They started this business 10 years ago, to cover their family's expenses, and raise their three daughters. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Be is requesting a loan to buy one more cow and fertilizer for planting.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Majlinda

texts.en:
Majlinda’s 27-year-old unmarried son passed away about a year ago and four months after him, her husband passed way as well. Majlinda  is 47 and has her 18-year-old daughter now. “My husband was struck from the grief from the death of our son, and that caused him a deadly heart attack,” said Majlinda.

Majlinda owns a little bar café on a main floor of the building where she and her daughter rent. Next to this, there is a little shop that she wants to open as a variety store. Her daughter can run it while she continues her university studies, and Majlinda will help her as well while she goes to school. The good thing is that there is no such a store in that neighborhood. 

Majlinda herself has worked in a factory where they made rugs and carpets, and she enjoys making her own rugs using the loom once in a while.

loans.use: to open up a variety store.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a forty-eight-year-old cattle trader who has done trade in cattle for the last twenty years. He works six days in a week and works twelve hours per day. The business is located in Ryanshana-Kashenyi-Bushenyi, and his clients are mainly cattle traders in the same area. In addition to the cattle trade, Eric also does some agriculture, which boosts his income greatly. 

He would like to use the loan money to buy cattle for trade so that he can make improved profits in the festive season of December. His main challenge is lack of enough capital. That is the reason why he has decided to borrow money so that he can improve his business and be able to earn more profits. 

Eric describes himself as a hardworking man and an honest man, attributes which have helped him to attain what he has attained. His future hopes include being financially well so that he does not lack again in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Christiana's Group

texts.en:
Christiana, who is an active member of this group, has been running an enterprise selling wax prints (African textiles) for five years now. She runs her business activities from 7:30 am to 6:00 pm and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

Christiana will use this loan to buy more wax prints to resell. This will be Christiana's first loan from ID-Ghana. She promises to repay the loan without default. She is doing great and still working hard to meet her business ambitions. She will use the extra money from her business to cover school fees and household expenses. Christiana dreams to own another successful enterprise and own a business bus. 

She will take this loan with her loan group which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying backing the loan.

loans.use: To buy more wax prints (African textiles) to resell.

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
Peace Group consists of four ladies and one gentleman. They have been working hard so that their businesses will provide them with the money they need to improve their own living conditions as well as those of their families. They live in Teshie, Accra. 

Samuel is 40 years old, married and has two children. He is a very hard-working person who has fought hard for a long time to get his family ahead in life. He has been selling second-hand clothing for six years. He has managed to attract a large number of customers. As a result, he enjoys very good sales. 

He is looking for a loan of GHS 1,000 so that he can buy a bale of second-hand clothing to meet the high level of demand that he has for his products. This will enable him to keep making progress in his business and to make the income he needs to support his household.

The Peace Group members need a sum of GHS 3,100 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second-hand clothing to meet the high level of demand that he has for his products.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma, age 25, is a married woman. She, along with her husband, is in the business of making artificial jewelry. The business has great potential for growth, and she makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She has four children, and wishes to provide them with good quality food, health, and education. 

In order to meet the orders on time and boost her sales, Uzma requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase raw materials, such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to get an increase in her net income, and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Fuzeta

texts.en:
Fuzeta is applying for a loan of $1,200.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has two children, and her husband is a driver. She is running a business in her house selling brick.  She opened her  business in 2012  with her working capital of $2000.00.

She is living a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She is making a good income from selling, and she wants to buy materials to make bricks with the loan.

loans.use: To buy an adobe print tool, sand, and cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fee for her daughter

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en:
Bopha is a mother of four children, and now is 52 years old. She is a villager from Sangke’s District of Battambang Province. To earn a living, she has been buying and selling kapok in the village. To add up more income, she also works for others for a fee as the main source of income. 

The business that she has had for more than 10 years has generated her about 31,200 KHR per day.  This is the sixth loan for Bopha with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to improve her business better than before. For this cycle, she has teamed up in a group of four to get a new loan. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more kapok to resale. She hopes that she can achieve a good crop yield.

loans.use: to buy more kapok to resale

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Unity Group consists of six ladies and two gentlemen. They have been working hard so that their businesses will provide them with the money they need to improve their own living conditions as well as those of their families. They live in Dansoman, Accra. 
Esther is 31 years old, married and has two children. She is a very hard-working person who has fought hard for a long time to get her family ahead in life. She has been selling wigs for 10 years. She has managed to attract a large number of customers. As a result, she enjoys very good sales. She is looking for a loan of GHS 1,800 so that she can buy more wigs to meet the high level of demand that she has for her products. This will enable her to keep making progress in her business and to make the income she needs to support her household. The Unity Group members need a sum of GHS 8,400 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more wigs to meet the high level of demand that she has for her products.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 35-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She has been running a business, selling animals for many years with the support of her father-in-law. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been working in hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people in her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hoping to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Shahida dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Edith Melene

texts.es: Edith de 22 años soltera y actualmente vive con sus padres. Lleva estudiando  dos años y medio el curso de inglés, donde le va muy bien. Los ingresos que percibe como auxiliar los destina para sus estudios y algunos gastos personales. Su mayor deseo continuar estudiando otros idiomas, y de esta manera seguir superándose. Solicitó el crédito para el pago de su matrícula y algunos materiales de estudio. Edith Agradece a sus padres y a Kiva por hacer posible dicho crédito.
texts.en: Edith is 22 years old, single and is currently living with her parents. She has been studying English for two years now and the course is going very well. Edith uses her income from her work as an assistant to pay for her studies and some personal expenses. Edith's biggest wish is to continue studying languages, and continue bettering herself. Edith is applying for this loan in order to pay matriculation fees and to buy some study materials. Edith is grateful to her parents and to Kiva for making this loan possible.

loans.use: to pay matriculation fees and to buy some study materials.

loans.name: Marleny Antonia

texts.es:
Marleny, se decidió por un nuevo crédito pues con el préstamo anterior ella pudo mejorar la alimentación que de daba a los cerdos que ya poseía y a los que compro, así mismo ha iniciado a practicar la crianza de pollos, su situación económica ha mejorado muchísimo con lo que se le ha facilitado la cancelación de la deuda y ofrece un mejor estilo de vida familiar.
En está ocasión invertirá en la compra de cerdos y alimento tanto para los cerdos como para los pollo, con lo que fortalecerá su negocio y continuara mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marleny has decided to take out another loan as her previous one helped her to improve the feed that she gave to the animals that she already owned and to the new ones that she bought. Marleny has also started to raise chickens. Her financial situation has improved greatly, helping her to pay off her loan and give her family a better quality of life.

Marleny will use this loan to buy pigs and to buy feed for both the chickens and the pigs. This will strengthen her business and Marleny will continue to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy pigs, and feed for pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of firewood to add to her current stock for sale.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 16 mai  2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte actuellement des femmes qui en plus de vivre ensemble dans le même village, gagnent en expérience dans leur activité respective car comprenant de mieux en mieux le programme cela favorisé par le fait que le village habite un grand « Louma » marché hebdomadaire. La solidarité et entre aide caractérisent les relations entre membre du groupe qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata (debout en blanc à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 57 ans, est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 03 filles et prend aussi en charge deux de ses petits enfants. Elle fait de l’embouche de petits ruminants moutons et chèvres qu’elle achète lors des marchés hebdomadaires du jeudi au village pour les revendre plus tard. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plus d’une vingtaine d’année.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter au moins 04 chèvres de 12 500 Frs CFA pièce pour les revendre plus tard.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’apporter son soutien à la fois à ses enfants et petits enfants en âges de scolarisation, en plus de satisfaire leur besoins en habillement, en nourriture et sanitaire.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 16, 2011 at the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. It consists of women who live in the same village. They are gaining experience in their respective activities through a greater understanding of the program, which is helped by the presence of a large weekly market (louma) in their village. The group members practice small trade, and they share a bond of mutual support and solidarity. 

Mrs. Fatoumata, age 57, (standing at the far right, dressed in white and raising her hand), is the featured borrower from this group. She is the married mother of ten children, three of them girls. She also takes care of two of her grandchildren. She fattens sheep and goats that she buys on Thursdays at the weekly market in the village, and sells them later on. She has extensive experience of over 20 years in this activity. She plans to use this new loan to buy at least four goats at 12,500 FCFA apiece to fatten and sell at a later date. 

She will use her profits to support her children and grandchildren' education, and to provide for their clothing, food and sanitary needs.

loans.use: to buy at least four goats at 12,500 FCFA apiece to fatten and sell at a later date.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 22-year-old, single Lebanese man who has worked for the past three years selling food such as homemade food, vegetables, and grains. He is a hardworking young man with a very friendly personality. He sells his products to shoppers from his local community and neighboring villages.

Today, Rabih wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase food to increase his sales and to renovate his shop with the aim of placing new trays to better display his products. Rabih is very eager to receive these funds to improve his business, as he is working at this time on building his own house and he plans to marry soon.  So, he badly needs to earn a larger income to handle these costly expenses.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell and to renovate his shop to better display his products

loans.name: Dúo Sandoval Group

texts.es:
Dúo Sandoval
LA SEÑORA ANGELA  quien es madre de 2 hijos  y es propietaria de   una venta de juguetes ubicada en el mercado de peronia , la cual inauguró  ella misma hace algunos años ella esta muy contenta porque le le ha ido muy bien ya que por recomendaciones de otras personas ella decidió aperturar su negocio actualmente ella vende 2 lotes de juguetes durante el mes y le va muy bien en sus ganancias, los hijos que tiene aun no van a la escuela tiene sueños y metas muy grandes los cuales desea poder llevar a cabo con sus hijos y su esposo e es por eso que ella hace de la solicitud de ustedes KIVA un crédito eL  cual utilizara para la inversión de un nuevo lote de juguetes pero en esta ocasión todo navideño agradeciendo que se le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud…
texts.en:
The Dúo Sandoval group

Angela is a mother to two children and owner of a toy stall in the market of Peronia, which she set up herself a few years ago. She is very happy as it has been going very well due to recommendations from other people she decided to open her business. She currently sells two batches of toys over the month and it is going very well in terms of profits. Angela's children are not yet at school, she has very big dreams and goals which she hopes to achieve with her children and her husband hence why she is seeking a loan from you via Kiva which she will use to invest in a new batch of toys. In this Christmas period she is grateful that her request is being taken into account.

loans.use: to buy toys for sale.

loans.name: Behruz

texts.ru: Бехруз предприниматель, проживающий в столице Таджикистана, в городе Душанбе. Ему 23 года. Он уже женат, но пока детей не имеет. Бехруз в центральном универсальном магазине имеет точку продажи, где занимается продажей телефонов и его аксессуаров. Жена работает вместе с ним. Это их семейный бизнес. Бехруз начал свой торговый бизнес два года тому назад и до сих пор продолжает его. Прибыль с бизнеса является единственным источником дохода семьи. Так как Бехруз привозит только качественный товар, за короткий срок он приобрел много клиентов. Сейчас он просит в кредит 2000 долларов США. Часть кредита он собирается потратить на закуп товара для развития торговли, а часть кредита потратить на ремонт дома, чтобы подготовиться к зиме.
texts.en:
Behruz is a businessman who lives in the capital of Tajikistan, Dushanbe. He is 23 years old. He is already married, but does not have any children yet. Behruz has a sales point at the central department store, where he sells phones and phone accessories. His wife works together with him. This is their family business. 

Behruz started his retail business two years ago, and still keeps it running. The income from the business is the only source of income for the family. As Behruz only sells quality goods, he managed to get many customers in a short period. 

Currently he requests a loan of 2,000 US dollar. He has decided to use part of the loan to purchase goods for expanding his business, and part on repairing his house, in order to prepare it for winter.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories to sell, and also to repair his house

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Она Сафаргул. Сафаргул является женой Умеда и матерью двоих детей. Сафаргулу 27 лет. Она с мужем растит шестилетнего сына и четырехлетнюю дочку. Сафаргул с семьей живет на районе Явана Республики Таджикистан.
    Сафаргул решила начать бизнес в сфере торговли одежды. Муж Сафаргул помог ей найти точку продажи, и ей осталось приобрести товар и начать продажу, но ее начальный капитал не позволяет ей приобрести первый товар, поэтому она просит кредит. Сафаргул с помощью кредита начнет деятельность, что даст ей образовать источник дохода в семью и в будущем стать бизнес леди.
texts.en: This is Safargul, a 27-year-old who lives with her family in the Yavan region of Tajikistan.  Safargul is the wife of Umed and the mother of two children; a 6-year-old and a 4-year-old.  She's decided to set up a new business dealing in buying and reselling clothing.  Her husband's helped her find a place to sell it from, but she lacks the money to buy an initial stock of wares.  As such, she's requesting a loan to stock up on clothing, which will help get her business up & running, give her family a stable source of income, and allow her to become a true businesswoman.

loans.use: stock up on clothing for resale

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia helps her husband in managing their own farm for a living. She was successful with their farm, so she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy a new variety of seedlings. She was determined enough to gain more profit from the farm to improve their living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of seedlings

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 44 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with two school-age  children. Joy has a business in snacks distributorship. This is how she earns a living, delivering snacks from school to school. She has had this business for two years.

 She requested a loan to purchase stock for her business.  Joy has been a member of PMPC for two months, In the future Joy  hopes to improve her living conditions and sustain the financial status for their needs.

loans.use: to purchase snacks to sell for her business

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido is 33 years old and lives in the Manga district of Tangub City. He is married with two children.

Bienvenido operates a business providing motorcycle repair and the sale of motorcycle accessories. He earns approximately 12,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to add to his capital to buy a second-hand unit of motorcycle. 

Bienvenido is a new member PMPC. In the future, Bienvenido hopes to improve his livelihood and provide more services to his clients.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand unit of motorcycle

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is married and has three children.  He sells his farm produce in town to earn a living.  After more than 20 years of farming, he has learned to sell his farm products in town to earn more income. 

To offer more goods, he took out a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit in order to purchase more vegetables and root crops to sell.  Rene always finds ways to augment their living. 

In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and root crops to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more clothing like pants, caps, bags, slipper and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing like pants, caps, bags, slipper and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old and has nine children. She is married and two of her children are still in school. Vilma is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Vilma requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her business. She has been raising livestock for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por otro crédito para incrementar sus ventas en la temporada de navidad, el capital lo invertirá para comprar ropa interior y blusas, para seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior surtió su inventario sus ventas son mejores, su economía ha mejorado, con sus nuevas ganancias ha cancelado sus deudas y compro un mostrador para exhibir sus productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa has decided on another loan in order to increase her sales during the Christmas season.  She will use the loan to buy underwear and blouses in order to continue satisfying her customers.

With the previous loan she stocked her inventory, and her sales are better.  Her finances have improved, and with the new income she has paid her debts.  She also bought a display case to show her products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy underwear and blouses.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been running a business, selling cloths for the past three years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then resells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 

Shazia requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season, by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing better standard of living for her family members through all her hard efforts in her business.
