In the future, Elyssa wants to see her business grow and hire more employees, but ultimately she hopes to build an oasis where clients can come to rejuvenate both physically and emotionally and then take that out into the world.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and products for opening her spa.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is a 25-year-old woman who is single with one child. 

She has a small business, flea market; she has many years with this business. 

Makerita needs a loan to buy materials, needles, sewing machine, buttons, earrings, and bangles. 

She will use her profits to assist with her family's everyday needs. 

Makerita joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, needles, sewing machine, buttons, earrings, and bangles

loans.name: Oka

texts.en: Oka is 25 years old and single with two children. She makes and sells elei lavalava (block printed clothing) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years. Oka has requested a loan to buy fabric color paints, materials, a paint roller, stencils and designs.She plans to use her profits to help with her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric color paints, materials, a paint roller, stencils and designs

loans.name: Seaso

texts.en: Seaso is 28 years old, a partnered woman with three children. She makes and sells elei lavalava (block printed clothing) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years. Seaso has requested a loan to buy materials, an elei carved board, designs, fabric color paints, brushes and gloves. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, an elei carved board, designs, fabric color paints, brushes and gloves

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 29-year-old partnered woman with four children. She makes and sells elei lavalava (block printed clothing) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years. Sami has requested a loan to buy designs, stencils, fabric color paint, brushes, a roller and cloth. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy designs, stencils, fabric color paints, brushes, a roller and cloth

loans.name: Evelin Altagracia

texts.es: Evelin tiene 31 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijos de 9 años y 2 años de edad. Para Evelin lo más importante es que sus hijos cuenten con una buena educación y con mejores condiciones de vida a las que ella ha tenido acceso. Ella se gana la vida como empleada de de una unidad de salud de su localidad. Tiene 4 años de trabajar como promotora de salud y es así como lleva el sustento a sus hijos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para mejorar el piso de la vivienda y para repellar las paredes del baño. Con el monto solicitado comprará: cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en: Evelin is 31 years old and a single mother of two children, 9 and 2 years old. For Evelin, the most important thing is that her children have a good education and better living conditions than she has had access to. She earns a living as an employee of a local health unit. She has worked as a health advocate for four years and this is how she supports her children. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to improve the floor of her home and to plaster the walls of the bathroom. With the requested sum she will buy cement, sand and gravel.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel for cementing the floor of the house and to plaster the bathroom walls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 20 y 14 años de edad, quienes a la fecha se ecuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. José es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable quien se gana la vida trabajando como albañil. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia por lo que desea construir una fosa séptica y una pila para reguardar el agua potable. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y pago de mano de obra para construir la fosa séptica y la pila que tanta falta le hacen.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children, ages 20 and 14, who at this time are attending the local public school. José is a very hard-working and responsible man who earns a living working as a construction worker.

He wishes to improve his living conditions and those of his family, so he wishes to install a septic tank and a tank for storing potable water. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI  to purchase the necessary materials such as cement, sand, gravel, rebar, and also to pay for labor to install the septic tank and water tank that he needs so much.

loans.use: To buy: cement, sand, gravel, rebar and pay for labor to install the septic tank and water tank.

loans.name: Rodney Jesus

texts.es: Rodney está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar enseres para su hogar como platos, ollas, entre otros y de esta manera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres y seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en: Rodney is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have offered him, he will be able to buy household articles for his home, such as plates, pots, and other items, and this way be able to improve his parents quality of life, and keep working and striving to make his greatest dream a reality: ”to have a university degree."

loans.use: To buy household items for his home.

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. 

Her husband owns a stitching center along with her elder son. They sew garments to order; there are many tailors working in the stitching center. Her husband teaches untrained workers, then gives them specific tasks for completion; in this way, he is discouraging unemployment as well. Her husband wants to buy a new sewing machine but he has already spent his savings on clothing, spools of thread, cloth, buttons and needles.

Due to a lack of funds, however, she is unable to buy the new sewing machine. Therefore, Sofia contacted BRAC Pakistan for a loan so that her husband can buy an additional sewing machine for the stitching center. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine for the stitching center.

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
Maritza le da gracias a campo alto que es el único instituto que le ha dado la oportunidad de poder estudiar y comodidad de poder pagar las estudios, pero en este  momento le pido  ayuda a kiva que le ha ayude para poder seguir con sus estudios ya que no le hes posible pagar las cuotas que le quedan un poco altas.

Ya que no es posible entrar a una universidad por falta económica y no tiene en este momento la ayuda, su mama es fallecida y le colabora a sus hermanos ya que se le hace muy dificl y tiene que pagar arriendo, servicios y no le daría basto, vive con una tía y les agradecería mucho si le pueden colaborar.

Gracias
texts.en:
Maritza is thankful to Campo Alto, which is the only school that has given her the opportunity of studying and easy payment terms. However, she is currently asking Kiva for help so that she can stay in school, since she hasn't been able to pay her fees, which are a bit too high for her.

Financially it's not possible for her to get into a university because she currently doesn't have any support. Her mother is deceased and she helps her siblings. It is very hard for her because she has to pay rent, utilities, and it isn't enough. She lives with an aunt and would very much appreciate any help Kiva lenders can offer. 

Thank you.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina is 25 years old and married with one child. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, freezer goods, and groceries. She has been doing this for many years. 

Sosefina needs a loan to buy sugar, salt, flour, rice, noodles, corned beef, tinned fish, milk, soy sauce, and toilet paper. She hopes to use her profits to help with her family's everyday needs. 

She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, flour, rice, noodles, corned beef, tinned fish, milk, soy sauce and toilet paper

loans.name: Letasia

texts.en:
Letasia is a 23-year-old woman who is single with three children. She has a small business, flea market; she has many years with this business. 

Letasia needs a loan to buy kava bowls, materials, earrings, bangles, table mats, beer holder, Samoa war weapon, sinnet, and siapo. 

She will use her profits to help and provide for her family financially. 

Letasia joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy kava bowls, materials, earrings, bangles, table mats, beer holder, Samoa war weapon, sinnet, and siapo

loans.name: Aitofi

texts.en:
Aitofi is 26 years old and single with 4 children. She makes and sells elei lava-lava (a traditional Polynesian cloth worn as a skirt) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years.

Aitofi has requested a loan to buy materials, fabric coloring paints, brushes, stencils and a roller. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric coloring paints, brushes, stencils and a roller

loans.name: Taalefili

texts.en:
Taalefili is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 year.

Taalefili has requested a loan to buy cordial, plastic bags, sugar, Chinese lollies (candy) and foam cups. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Taalefili will make improvements to her house and take care of her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy cordial, plastic bags, sugar, Chinese lollies (candy) and foam cups

loans.name: Iacinta

texts.en:
Iacinta is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She makes and sells elei lava-lava (a traditional Polynesian cloth worn as a skirt) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years.

Iacinta has requested a loan to buy elei carved designs, fabric coloring paints, gloves and stencils. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy elei carved designs, fabric coloring paints, gloves and stencils

loans.name: Aereopaquita Nidia

texts.es:
Areopaquita de 65 años de edad, soltera con un hijo mayor de edad. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de su familia pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente desde muy joven ha trabajado para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir de adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos como rubor, sombra de ojos, lápiz de ojos, labiales, perfumes, cremas, delineador, rubor. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias de forma ambulante y  por encargo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de cosmético y aprovechar las ventas de la temporada navideña, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Areopaquita agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Areopaquita is 65 years old, single, and has an adult son. She is from Leon, a place located in the north of the country. Its inhabitants are known for being hard-working and responsible, with a desire to succeed. In her free time she likes to enjoy her family's company and spend quality time with them. Unfortunately, from an early age she has worked to help with the household expenses. 

Thanks to her effort and her desire to succeed, she has as her business the sale of cosmetics, such as rouge, eyeshadow, eyebrow pencil, lipsticks, perfumes, creams and eyeliner. She has been working at her business for eight hours a day, selling door to door and by order. The purpose of the loan is to have working capital for the purchase and sale of cosmetics, and to take advantage of the Christmas sales season, so that in the not too distant future she can obtain better income. 

Areopaquita is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to low-income people in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use:
To invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling cosmetics such as blush, eyeshadow, eyeliner, lipstick, perfumes,
creams, and eyeliner.

loans.name: Santos Reinaldo

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado en la comunidad donde vive, se casó hace 19 años, su esposa trabaja junto con el apoyándolo para el desarrollo de la familia, ella se dedica a la comercialización de especies (canela, achiote, pimienta, cominos, ajos, etc.) y también destaza cerdos con lo cual ayuda  a sus hijos, pues tiene cinco de 21, 18, 15, 12 y 8 años de edad, los cuales los mayores le ayudan en los trabajos de albañilería, también vive con él una nieta.
Tres de sus hijos estudian el nivel básico en la comunidad. El año fue difícil para él, pues sus padres murieron.
Santos trabaja en la albañilería, pues un amigo con el cual él trabajaba le enseño el oficio en el año 95, emigro por cinco años a los estados unidos, pues la situación en el país estaba bastante difícil por la guerra en los años pasados. Trabaja de lunes a sábado dependiendo del trabajo que realice.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar madera, teja y lámina, para mejorar la vivienda en donde reside y también la casa donde vivieron sus padres y lo creció a él y a sus hermanos.
Santos  sueña con hacer una casa de ladrillo, pues con los ahorros que él tenía compro el terreno donde ahora tiene su casa, pero planea hacerla de ladrillo para tener una vivienda más digna.
Esta con toda la disposición de ayudar a sus hijos  con los estudios,  para que sean profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Santos is a man of 39. He went to school through sixth grade in the community where he lives. He married 19 years ago. His wife works with him, supporting him in the development of the family. She sells spices (cinnamon, achiote, pepper, cumin, garlic, etc) and also butchers pigs, work that their children help with, since they have five children, ages 21, 18, 15, 12, and 8. The older ones help him in his masonry work. A granddaughter also lives with him.

Three of his children are going to school at the basic level in the community. The year was difficult for him, since his parents died.

Santos works in masonry, since a friend with whom he was working taught him the trade in 1995. He emigrated to the United States for 5 years, since in past years the situation in the country was quite difficult because of the war. He works from Monday to Saturday, depending on the work that he is doing.

The loan that he is applying for is to buy wood, tiles, and [metal] sheets to improve the house where he lives and also the house where his parents lived and where they raised him and his siblings.

Santos dreams of having a brick house, since with his savings he bought the land where he now has his house, but he is planning to make it of brick to have a better home.

He is fully supportive of helping his children with their schooling, so that they can have careers in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood, tile, and metal sheets to improve the house where he lives and also the house where his parents lived and raised him and his siblings

loans.name: Gerardo Erickson

texts.es: Gerardo agradece el gran apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para pequeño negocio de venta de verduras y frutas como papa al por mayor, cebolla, pallares, frejoles, entre otros; con lo cual podrá mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos y de esta manera poder seguir creciendo y luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en: Gerardo is grateful for the great help that Kiva lenders are offering him because thanks to their help he will be able to buy merchandise for his small business selling vegetables and fruit, such as wholesale potatoes, onions, white beans, pinto beans, and other items. This will allow him to improve his sales and his income so that he can keep growing and fighting for his great dream, which is to own a minimart.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Abdulmoamn

texts.en: Abdulmoamn is 24 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store that sells basic products for two years. He started his business with supporting capital from his father in order to open his business. Because of his dedication to his work, he has been able to attract customers to his business. He says he needs to fill his store with more food products in order to serve his customers. So he applied for a youth loan of 350,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery products that bring in more profit. In the future, he would like to expand his business to open a wholesale store instead of his grocery.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products that bring in more profit.

loans.name: Oygul

texts.ru: Ойгул вместе со своей семьей живет в отдаленном регионе на северной части Таджикистана. Ойгул замужем и имеет 4 детей. Она является повторной клиентом ИМОН и имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Ойгул честная женщина и поэтому ее бизнес процветает год за годом. Она занимается скотоводством многие годы. Ойгул имеет постоянных клиентов и поэтому она хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Oygul and her family live in a region in the far south of Tajikistan.  She is married with 4 children, and has previously borrowed through IMON, where she has an excellent credit record.  She is an honest woman, and believes it's the reason why her business has grown year after year.  She is a cattle farmer by trade, and has a number of regular customers whom she sells her animals to.  At the moment, she is seeking to borrow $2,000 (USD) to buy more cattle, and is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is a 42-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Mele has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a spade, a hose, a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray, a pair of gloves and a rake. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Mele hopes to improve her business to help her family matters and her kid's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a spade, a hose, a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray, a pair of gloves and a rake

loans.name: Seleisa

texts.en:
Seleisa is 39 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community and has been doing this for 2 years.

Seleisa has requested a loan to buy chicken, sausages, mutton flaps (lamb or mutton belly meat), soy sauce, tomato sauce, garlic, onions and foam plates. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Seleisa will make improvements to her house and take care of her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soy sauce, tomato sauce, garlic, onions and foam plates

loans.name: Loine

texts.en:
Loine is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling fish, crabs and octopus in her community and has been doing this for 3 years.

Loine has requested a loan to buy a spear, fishing gear, fishing net and a new canoe. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Loine will extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a spear, fishing gear, fishing net and a new canoe

loans.name: Motootua

texts.en:
Motootua is 41 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a canteen in her community and has been doing this for many years.

Motootua has requested a loan to buy noodles, milk, coffee, chicken, sausages, snacks and soft drinks. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Motootua will take care of her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy noodles, milk, coffee, chicken, sausages, snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Pene

texts.en:
Pene is 56 years old and married with 6 children. She plans to extend her business by selling tinned fish, powder, flour, sugar, salt, ice cream, ice pops, chicken legs, etc. 

She has requested a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, flour, sugar, rice, salts, onions and chicken. Pene will use her profits to help with family matters and her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, flour, sugar, rice, salts, onions and chicken

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda de 29 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta de frijol en las afueras del mercado de Santiago Sac, tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ya ha trabajodo varios creditos ne kiva y no a caido en mora, en esta ocacion nuevamente solicita un nuevo credito para la compra de frijol ya que desea seguir creciendo en su negocio les agradese por su ayuda ya que por medio de los credito ella ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en: Florinda is 29 years old and sells beans outside of the market in Santiago, Sacatepequez. She has been doing this for several years. She has borrowed from Kiva before and paid back on time. On this occasion she requests a new loan to buy beans and keep her business growing. She appreciates the help and with this loan she will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy wholesale quantities of beans.

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie is 44-years-old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She is widowed with two children. 

Annalie has a stall and is engaged in the direct selling of AVON, Natasha, MSE and Personal Collection products and earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional products of MSE, AVON, Natasha and two bundles of relief goods for sale.  Annalie has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Annalie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products of MSE, AVON and Natasha

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is married to a farmer with three children who are school-age.  Presentacion is 42-years-old and lives in Barangay Manga, Tangub City.

Presentacion sells lubricants to earn a living and has had this business for two years.  Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase lubricants for her store.

Presentacion is a new a member of PMPC.  In the future, Presentacion hopes to improve her livelihood in order for her to provide more services for her clients and also to provide the daily needs of her three children.

loans.use: to purchase lubricants

loans.name: Santos Enrique

texts.es:
Santos de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado de educación, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos,  decidió ya no seguir y se dedicó desde los 14 años a la elaboración de hamacas, él es casado y también su esposa le ayuda a tejer y también sus hijos, él tiene 6 hijos,  2 asisten a la escuela  y una que trabaja con otro artesano y los otros 3 le ayudan a trabajar en lo que es la elaboración de hamacas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  material para la elaboración de hamacas, comprara 25 royos de naylon que le cuesta cada uno $ 15 dólares,  él necesita tener material suficiente para hacer hamacas y salir a vender, ya que el antes trabajaba para un patrón y solo ganaba 3 dólares por elaborar una hamaca.

El a futuro planea hacer y establecer un taller de elaboración de hamacas que le permita tener una mayor incidencia en el mercado con las hamacas y así poder tener un mercado en la cual venda las hamacas constantemente.
texts.en:
Santos, 33, has only a 4th grade education.  He decided not to continue in school because he lacked financial resources, so 14 years ago he started working making hammocks.  He is married, and his wife and children also help him with the weaving.  He has 6 children, 2 of whom are in school, and one who is working with another craftsman.  His other 3 children work with him in his business making hammocks.

Santos is requesting this loan to buy supplies to make hammocks.  He will buy 25 rolls of nylon that each cost $15.  He needs to have enough raw materials to make hammocks to go out and sell, because before he used to work for a boss, and he only earned $3 for every hammock he made.

In the future, Santos plans to set up a hammock workshop that would enable him to have a greater impact on the hammock market.  This way, he could be constantly selling his hammocks in the market.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make hammocks

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en: Marigen is 42-years-old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with six children.  For their means of living, Marigen earns income from her eatery business and sari-sari (convenience) store.  She earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase sacks of rice, meats, beefs, dressed chicken, spices, vegetables and seasonings for her eatery business and groceries for her retail store.  Marigen has been a member of PMPC since last July 2013.  In the future, Marigen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, meats, beefs, dressed chicken, spices, vegetables, seasonings and groceries

loans.name: Pisi

texts.en:
Pisi is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store selling items such as snacks, frozen goods and groceries. She has been doing this for many years.

Pisi needs a loan to buy milk, noodles, toilet rolls, mosquito coils, snacks, soft drinks, sugar, salt, flour, corned beef, tinned fish, laundry soap, laundry powder, cooking oil and snacks. She hopes to use her profits to help with her family's everyday needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy milk, noodles, toilet rolls, mosquito coils, snacks, soft drinks, sugar, salt, flour, corned beef, tinned fish, laundry soap, laundry powder, cooking oil and snacks

loans.name: Faamita

texts.en:
Faamita is 52 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 year.

Faamita has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil and baking soda. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faamita will take care of her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil and baking soda

loans.name: Kerupi

texts.en:
Kerupi is 30 years old and single with 3 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling meat buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, sugar, oil, a large cooking pot, salts, onions and chicken.

In the future, Kerupi hopes to use her profits to help her family and her improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, sugar, oil, a large cooking pot, salts, onions and chicken

loans.name: Iusitina

texts.en:
Iusitina is 32 years old and married with 1 child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, oil, sugar, salts, a large cooking pot and chicken.

In the future, Iusitina hopes to use her business profits to help her family and her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, salts, a large cooking pot and chicken

loans.name: Duglas Yovani

texts.es:
Duglas de 37 años de edad, quien no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a que solo su madre creció a los cuatro hermanos más que él tuvo y fue así como aprendió a trabajar en diferentes áreas donde obtenía ingresos económicos para sacar adelante a la familia.
Su esposa es quien pasa cuidando en el hogar y a sus hijos,  mientras él trabaja todos los días de la semana en la alcaldía del pueblo de fontanero.
Sus hijos están aún pequeños y no están asistiendo a la escuela a recibir sus clases.
Duglas trabaja de fontanero desde el 2006 y todos los días se va a abrir el grifo para abastecer de agua  a un cantón a las dos de la mañana y es así como él se gana la vida, para darle a sus hijos una vida mejor, tiene que caminar durante más de 30 minutos caminando por veredas en los cerros para llegar a su trabajo.  Él durante muchos tiempos trabajo haciendo cumas y machetes, trabajo que le enseño su tío desde pequeño y fue donde se creció toda la vida, también aprendió la albañilería muy joven pues su padre los abandono y fue la necesidad que lo hizo aprender varios oficio.
Duglas es trabajador, cuando tiene su tiempo libre, trabaja en la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y sorgo)
Duglas solicita un crédito en credicampo, para comprar 500 bloques y cemento, para construir una parte de su casa, ya que le urge porque en el tiempo de invierno se le inunda de agua la casa, y es necesario hacer la mejora en la vivienda, la cual él lo realizara, ya tiene parte del hierro, piedra y arena.
Con ello Duglas tendrá más seguridad para su familia y ya no pasaran momentos de apuros en el hogar cuando llegue el invierno.
Duglas sueña con darle a sus hijos la educación que él no tuvo en su juventud, el préstamo le será muy útil pues hace falta hacer mejoras en su vivienda, poco a poco ira mejorando su vivienda hasta tener toda su casa de bloques, debido a que hoy es de lámina y con el crédito reparara solo la parte en donde se le moja.
texts.en:
Duglas is 37 years old. He did not have the opportunity to go to school because his mother was raising four more children besides himself, and it was thus that he learned to work in different areas where he obtained income to raise the family.

His wife is the one who cares for the home and their children while he works every day of the week as a plumber for the town government. His children are still young and are not going to school to attend classes.

Duglas has worked as a plumber since 2006, and every day at 2 in the morning he goes to open the water tap to stock the water for the district, and this is how he earns his living, to give his children a better life. He has to walk for more than 30 minutes on paths in the mountains to arrive at his work. For a long time he worked making knives and machetes, work that his uncle taught him when he was very young, and this was how he grew up for his whole life. He also learned masonry as a youth, since his father abandoned them and it was necessary that he learn various trades. Duglas is a hard worker. When he has free time, he works in agriculture (he plants corn, beans, and sorghum).

Duglas is applying for a loan from CrediCampo to buy 500 blocks and cement to construct part of his house, since it is urgent, because in the winter the house is flooded and it is necessary to make the improvement in the house, which he will do. He already has part of the iron, stone, and sand. With this repair, Duglas will have more security for his family and they won't have times of hardship in the house when winter arrives. 

Duglas dreams of giving his children the education that he didn't have in his youth. The loan will be very useful since there is a need to make improvements in his home. Little by little he will improve his home until his entire house is made of cement blocks, since now it is made of metal sheets, and with the loan he will repair only the part that gets wet.

loans.use: to buy 500 blocks and cement to construct part of his house; it is urgent because in the winter it is flooded with water.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married with six children. Juanita is 58-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Juanita is a farmer and grows vegetables and crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm.

Juanita has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Juanita hopes to be a supplier of vegetables to the market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

location.town: Pagadian - Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 61-years-old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with two children.  For their means of living, Leonila is known in this town as one of the makers of chocolate tablets and coffee. She is earning an approximate amount of PHP 5,000 each month in doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase sacks of cacao and coffee beans for her chocolate tablet and coffee processing and production business.  Leonila has been a member of PMPC since last November 2011. In the future, Leonila hopes to expand her business to other cities and provinces and that it will have its own product name.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cacao and coffee beans

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is 58-years-old and lives in Pagadian.  She is married with five children.

Carlita has a shop that sells goods and dry goods.  She has had this business for five years.  She requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities.  Carlita has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Carlita hopes to have a grocery store someday.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 46 years old and lives in Pagadian. She is married with 3 children. Jovita has a shop that sells dry goods. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store.

Jovita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Jovita hopes to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married with 3 children. Julieta is 56 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines. Julieta is a farmer and grows rice and fruit crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She has requested a loan to buy sacks of fertilizers.

Julieta has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Julieta hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruchel

texts.en:
Ruchel is 44 years old, married and resident of Manguiles, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have 4 children, two of whom are in school. Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, Ruchel opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of PMPC. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member last January 2013 and has taken out two loans. 

Now, Ruchel is applying for 14,000 PHP to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store business, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is widowed with 5 children. Myrna is 54 years old and lives in Colambutan Settlement, Tudela, Philippines. Myrna is a farmer and grows ginger crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizers.

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Myrna hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Panchita

texts.en:
Panchita is 65-years-old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She is widowed with four children who are now adults. 

Panchita has a little store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

Panchita has been a member of PMPC since last December 2013.  In the future, Panchita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Ruflan

texts.en:
Ruflan is 38-years-old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  He is single and has no dependents.
 
Ruflan is engaged in a hog fattening business and earns an approximate amount of not less than PHP 3,000 from this activity.  He has requested a loan to be used to purchase a piglet and sacks of feed for his hog fattening business.  

Ruflan has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Ruflan hopes to engage in other types of businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a piglet and sacks of feed

loans.name: Retchel

texts.en:
Retchel is 29-years-old and lives in Paglaum Dumalinao ZDS.  She is married with four children.

She has a motorcycle business and earns approximately only 15,000 pesos each month.  She has a requested a loan to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

Retchel has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, she hopes for a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Marla

texts.en:
Marla is 48 years old, married and a resident of Manguiles, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. They have 4 children, one of whom is in school. Starting with capitalization of 5,000 PHP, Marla opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of PMPC. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member last October 2012 and has taken out five loans. 

Now, Marla is applying for 7,000 PHP to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store business, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is widowed with four children. She is 73 years old and lives in Nailon, Tudela, Philippines.

Josefina sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Josefina has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to support her family in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a drywall house.

loans.name: Mere

texts.en:
Mere is 41 years old and married with four children. 

She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, and oil, a large cooking pot, and a new oven. 

In the future, Mere hopes to use her business profit for her family and her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, and oil, a large cooking pot, and a new oven.

loans.name: Falematai

texts.en:
Falematai is a 21-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, green onions, tomatoes, green peppers, and carrots to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year.

Falematai has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, chemicals, hose, a wheelbarrow, and gloves. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013. With her profits, Falematai hopes to improve her business and to save for her kids' educations.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, chemicals, hose, a wheelbarrow, and gloves.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señorita Mariana, tiene 47 años de edad, está  soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan para salir adelante.
Doña Mariana es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante y con esto poder ayudarles a sus padres que son de escasos recursos, ella todos los días instala un pequeño local en una calle de la ciudad en la cual muchas personas venden alimentos, prepara deliciosos ceviches de pescado y tiene mucha clientela. Ella también a vende ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), los mismos que vende en su local o sale a recorrer la ciudad, ya son muchos años que lleva con su negocio lo cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, gaseosas y otros víveres para preparar los ceviches. Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the 24 de Mayo canton of the Manabí province, the "Nuevo Horizontes de 24 de Mayo" loan group meets. Manabí is known for its beautiful landscapes and its hard-working people who make a living in farming and raising animals.

And it is here that 47-year-old Mariana lives. She is single and lives with her parents. She has been with the loan group since the beginning and likes it because the loans help her to get ahead.

Mariana is a plucky woman who has always liked to work in order to prosper and to help her poor parents. Every day Mariana has a stall in one of the city's streets where many people sell foods. Mariana prepares a delicious "ceviche" (a fish dish) and she has many customers. She also sells clothes from catalogues and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She sells these at her premises or goes round the city to do it. Mariana has had the business for many years and it has allowed her to get ahead. 

Mariana will use this loan to buy fish, fizzy drinks and other supplies for preparing the "ceviche". Mariana's dream is to get ahead,

loans.use: to buy fish, fizzy drinks and other supplies.

loans.name: Siiva

texts.en:
Siiva is 26 years old and married with five children. She makes and sells elei printing materials to earn a living and has been doing this for one year.

Siiva has requested a loan to buy paints, design board, roll materials, brushes, rubbers, and a new sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and her kids' educations. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, design board, roll materials, brushes, rubbers, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Malofouina

texts.en:
Malofouina is a 22-year-old married woman; she has no children. She has a small farm where for the past year she has grown tomatoes, cabbage, corn, green onions and green beans to earn a living.

Malofouina has been a member of SPBD since 2013. She is applying for a 1,000 WST loan to buy weed killer, weed spray, a wheelbarrow, a hose, a pair gloves and some shovels. With her profits, she hopes to improve her farm and help her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Koreti is a 58-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business, taxi services. She has been in this business for two years.

Koreti needs a loan to buy new seat covers and pay for maintenance, engine overhaul, registration, engine oil and fluid. She will use her profits to improve her taxi service and help her kids’ educations. 

Koreti joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new seat covers and pay for maintenance, engine overhaul, registration, engine oil and fluid.

loans.name: Ulalei

texts.en:
Ulalei is a 33-yearold woman who is married with four children. She has a small business, a taxi service. She needs a loan to buy engine oil, seat covers, fluid and a spare tire. 

She will use her profits to help her family living and upgrade her business. Ulalei joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy engine oil, seat covers, fluid and a spare tire.

loans.name: Nofoilo

texts.en:
Nofoilo is 48 years old and married with seven children. She has a small garden where she grows taros, bananas, cucumbers, tomatoes and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Nofoilo needs a loan to buy fertilizers, weed killers, a wheelbarrow, gloves, shovels and a rake. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Nofoilo will use the profits from her sales to support her family and also her kids’ schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, weed killers, a wheelbarrow, gloves, shovels and a rake.

loans.name: Taulelea

texts.en:
Taulelea is 44 years old and married with six children. For the past three years she has grown taro, cabbages, cucumbers and bananas which she sells in her community or at the market.

Taulelelea is applying for a 1,000 WST loan through SPBD to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, gloves, shovels, a bush knife, a mist blower and a rake. She will use the profits from her produce to support her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 53, is married and has ten children. She would like to start a taxi service.

Mary joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to its financial services. She is applying for a 1,000 WST loan to buy a spare tire and engine oil, plus brake and steering fluids. She will use her profits to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire and engine oil, plus brake and steering fluids.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 55 años casada, ella se dedica a la venta de redes de pesca, su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicada en la localidad de Batallas, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Juana va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un terreno que está a buen precio en una localidad cercana de donde vive, La Sra. Juana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la época que no hay pesca ya que no puede vender sus productos y esto le perjudica mucho, y así de esta manera no le permite generar más ingresos económicos, su deseo es una ves que compre su terreno poder hacer construir ahí ambientes para comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is 55 years old and married. She sells fishing nets from her vending post located in the town of Batallas. This loan is her first transaction with Emprender.

Sra. Juana will use this loan to buy a plot of land at a good price that is in a town close to where she lives. She faces challenges in her business, such as enduring the season when no fishing takes place. This means she is not able to sell her products and must go through great hardship since there is no way for her to generate more income.

Her wish is to buy a plot of land so that she can build amenities for her family's comfort.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy and her husband are rice farmers. She wants to continue her farming business by maintenance; hence, she decided to apply for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide.

Chanthy lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four children, three sons and one daughter. All of her children are in school. 

Chanthy is pictured at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Dúo Trabajo Y Cosecha Group

texts.es:
DUO TRABAJO Y COSECHA
Don Tranquilino es originario de la aldea  Pacorral, municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 43 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus cuatro hijos menores de edad, el se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que lo viene realizando desde hace años.
Don Tranquilino se dedica a la siembra de Maíz, frijol, verduras y a la siembra de fresa, desde hace años. Gracias a Dios y gracias al apoyo de toda su familia el sigue adelante con su trabajo en la agricultura.
El sueño de el es mejorar sus siembras a través de un invernadero, ya que así  el tendrá mejores productos y mejorara sus ganancias así podrá mandar sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para la agricultura.
texts.en:
"Duo Trabajo Y Cosecha"

Tranquilino is from the village of a Pacorral, in Tecpan municipality, Guatemala. He is 43 years old and has four minor children in his care. He farms, a  livelihood he has been engaged in for years.

Tranquilino has been growing corn, beans, vegetables, as well as strawberries for years. Fortunately, and thanks to the support of his whole family, his farming is successful.

His dream is to improve his crops by building a greenhouse, as this way he will have better products and will improve his earnings. With this, he will be able to send his children to school so that they can have a better future. 

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and manure for agriculture.

loans.use: To buy seeds and manure for agriculture.

loans.name: Nofoilo

texts.en:
Nofoilo is an 18-year-old young lady with no children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience doing so.

Nofoilo has been a member of SPBD since 2013. She is applying for a 1,000 WST loan to buy sugar, flavoring, foam cups and a new freezer. She plans to use her profits to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flavoring, foam cups and a new freezer.

loans.name: Vicenta Calixta

texts.es:
Vicenta es una señora casada de 51 años de edad, vive junto a sus 5 hijos de los cuales son; 3 hombres y dos mujeres, quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Ella y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de pantalones de vestir y lo realizan en su vivienda. Ella eligió esta actividad ya que su esposo anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila y es por ello que tomaron la decisión de emprender este negocio que es bastante productivo, en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias. Como también comenta que la labor que realizan lo distribuyen en la ciudad capital.
Ella ahora ve que este negocio tiene una fuerte demanda por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,050.00 para la compra de tela y productos de costura, para poder elaborar más prendas de vestir y así darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es tener un local en su comunidad para poder exponer su producto, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Vicenta is a fifty-one year old woman. She lives together with her three sons and two daughters in the Sololá Department. 

She and her husband make dress pants at their home. She chose this work because her husband previously worked at a textile mill. For this reason, they decided to undertake this business, which is quite productive in regard to income. She also states that they distribute their products in the capital city.

Vicenta now sees that there is a strong demand for this business; therefore, she is applying for a loan of 3,050 Guatemalan quetzales to buy sewing products and fabric, which she will use to make more clothing to provide better customer service.

Her biggest dream is have a business site in her community where she could display her goods in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing products and fabric for making dress pants.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis is from the Argavand village of the Armavir region. He has been involved in agriculture for many years.

Near the village where Aramayis lives with his family, he owns land where different types of vegetables are cultivated (tomato, onion, greens, etc.). Aramayis also keeps livestock which includes a pig and 12 chickens.

Aramayis's family helps him with running a farm. His wife takes care of livestock and his 20-years-old son assists his father to gather the harvest and sell it. Aramayis now asks for this loan to be able to increase the farm that he owns. With the help of this loan of USD 3000, Aramayis will be able to purchase 2 oxen, forage for feeding animals and fertilizer. This is very important for his further farming activities and he hopes for Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 2 oxen, forage for feeding animals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en: Debbie is 42 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells pancakes to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, a large frying pan and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, a large frying pan and a new oven.

loans.name: Mariaana

texts.en:
Mariaana is 44 years old and married, with six children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Mariaana has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, gloves, shovels, a wheel barrow, and a mist blower. She became a member of SPBD this year. 

With her profits,Mariaana hopes to save for her children's education and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, gloves, shovels, a wheel barrow, and a mist blower.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en: Cathy is a 23-year-old married woman with two children. She would like to start a small business, selling ie lavalava [a traditional type of clothing, worn as a skirt] in her community. In order to do this, Cathy needs a loan to buy a design board, paint brush, fabric material, needles, threads and a new sewing machine. She hopes to use her profits to save for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy a design board, paint brush, fabric material, needles, threads and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de tres hijos. Tiene 36 años de edad. De oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio este negocio hace  varios años, con el apoyo de su esposo y dinero propio, desde entonces, instalo su negocio. Hoy en día cuenta son su pulpería prospera y surtida. Su meta próxima es poner una librería en el mismo local de su pulpería. Solicita un crédito para comprar: cremas, perfumes, zapatos, artículos escolares, entre otros, con el fin de ofertar en su pulpería artículos variados. Estima que el crédito será de mucho beneficio ya que podrá incrementar sus ganancias y crecer su negocio. Su plan futuro es apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor is from the city of Estelí. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children. A business person by occupation, she has a small general store. She started this business several years ago with her husband's help and with her own money, and since then has opened her store.

Now she has a prosperous and well-supplied general store. Her next goal is to set up a bookstore in the same premises as her general store. She is requesting a loan to buy creams, perfumes, shoes, school supplies, and other items, with the aim of offering a variety of items in her store.

She thinks that the loan will be a great help, as she will be able to increase her earnings and see her business grow. Her plan for the future is to help her children with their education.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, shoes, school supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Melsa

texts.en:
Melsa previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She is requesting another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed for her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melsa hopes that her business will last long and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed for her business.

loans.name: Sinourn

texts.en:
Sinourn, aged 21, is a second-year university student at Chenla University. At the nursing college, her major is midwifery. Her ambition is to finish her studies and work in a public hospital. Also, she wants to have her own clinic when she has enough capital and experience. Her education is subsidized by her parents.

Due to the shortage of funds, Sinourn would like to borrow a new loan to cover the costs of her school allowances for the first semester and buy supplies such as books and uniforms. After graduation, Sinourn hopes to earn a good salary so she is able to help her parents when they are older, and improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future. Sinourn is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via programs like Kiva to allow poor students to pursue a higher education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her school allowances for the first semester and buy supplies such as books and uniforms.

loans.name: Karin Group

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha  de 46  años de edad casada  y madre de  3 hijos, la Sra. Bertha  tiene una pequeña bodega   ya hace unos  8 años. La Sra. Bertha  ,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su bodega  (arroz, azúcar, menestras, etc.)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Bertha   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Bertha  es la segunda de la mano derecha  se le distingue por su polo de color lavanda,Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Bertha is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has had a small grocery shop for about eight years now. She has built a loyal customer base, which has helped her to earn enough money to cover her household expenses. In the future she would like to have her own retail space where she could sell her products and earn more income. 

Bertha will invest this loan in the purchase of more products for her grocery store, such as rice, sugar, legumes, etc. This will let her continue to satisfy her customers' needs and get ahead in this way. Bertha and all of the group's members are very grateful to Kiva for the loan they have been granted and for the trust put in them. 

Bertha is the second person from the righthand side and is wearing a lavender t-shirt. She signs off with the promise that she will achieve all of her goals.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store, such as rice, sugar, and legumes.

loans.name: Ailua

texts.en: Ailua is a 22-year-old woman who is married with 2 children. She has a small business, taxi service. She needs a loan to buy a spare tire, fluids, brakes, engine oil and seat covers. She will use her profits to help her family and to upgrade her business. Ailua joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, fluids, brakes, engine oil and seat covers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with two children. She is 58 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan,Tudela, Philippines. Virginia is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve their general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Geoconda Anabell

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Geoconda, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, uno mayor de edad y dos de 17 y 15 años, el mayor estudia en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es técnico electricista.
Doña Geoconda es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para varias actividades, una parte es para que su marido la utilice en su trabajo, el cual realiza arreglos de artefactos electrónicos y requiere del crédito para comprar repuestos que el necesita, la otra parte del crédito ella lo utiliza para los gastos que generan los estudios de sus hijos ya que para ella eso es lo más importante.
Este crédito es para comprar repuestos para su marido y para comprar ciertos libros y útiles escolares para sus hijos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque la institución le ayuda mucho. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the province of Manabí, one can find the Veinticuatro de Mayo Canton. It is here where the credit group "Nuevos Horizontes de 24 de Mayo" gathers together. The area is known for its beautiful landscapes and hardworking people who make a living through agriculture and animal husbandry.

In this place, there lives Geoconda. She is forty-three years old. She is married and has three children. One of her children is of legal age, and the other two are aged fifteen and seventeen. The oldest attends college and the younger ones, high school. Her husband is an electrician.

Geoconda is a very good wife who is taking out this loan for several uses. A part of this loan is for her husband's business; he repairs electronic devices and he needs the loan to buy spare parts. The other part of the loan will be used to cover her children's educational expenses, which is the most important thing for her.

This loan is to buy spare parts for her husband and specific textbooks and school supplies for her children. She has been a part of the credit group since the beginning, and she likes it because the institution helps her a lot. Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, school supplies, and textbooks.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван живет и работает в Виноградово. Он занимается теплицами, имеет в пользовании 0.25 соток земли возле своего дома. На них расположены 5 теплиц. В бизнесе Ивана задействована вся его семья. 
Иван хочет закупить для теплиц пленку на 3 000 гривен, семена на 5 000 гривен и сделать ремонт одной из теплиц на 2 000 гривен. Со временем Иван планирует купить грузовой автомобиль для своего бизнеса, так как транспортировать товар иначе крайне дорого и невыгодно. В этом году также планирует жениться, подкопив денег за сезон.
texts.en:
Ivan lives and works in Vinogradovo. He is engaged in greenhouses, using .25 acres of land near his home, where he has five greenhouses. Ivan's whole family is involved in his business. 

He wants to buy greenhouse film for 3,000 UAH, seeds for 5,000 UAH and pay for repairs on one of his greenhouses for 2,000 UAH. Ivan also plans to buy a truck for his business to transport goods; otherwise it's very expensive and unprofitable. This year he plans to get married which will also require money.

loans.use: to buy plastic film for his greenhouses, as well as seeds and repairs on one greenhouse.

loans.name: Angela Julieth

texts.es:
Ella es Angela una persona valiente capaz de salir adelante, como inspiración tiene al hijo, motor de la vida y esta convencida de  que estudiar con dedicación y entrega es el primer paso para empezar a realizar los proyectos, el primer peldaño de la escalera del Éxito es lograr la estabilidad económica, para poder  brindarle todo lo que el hijo necesite.
Quiere llegar a ser la profesional que cualquiera desearía tener en la empresa, ama la vida, ama los sueños; la interminable lucha es por sobresalir ,decidió estudiar Cosmetologia y Estética Integral, porque tiene la certeza que es esta  la carrera que le cambiara la vida, por el medio laboral que tiene y por la necesidad que existe de preservar la belleza y todo lo que esto implica.
Siempre la motivo el deseo de salir adelante,  pero es ahora el momento en que se le presenta la oportunidad,  por eso es muy necesario y oportuno este subsidio con kiva ya que le brinda seguridad para seguir estudiando.
Con una visión muy clara de adonde quiere llegar ella quiere que el hijo, papa, hermanas, hermano y sobrinos puedan sentirse honrados de ella, que la mama desde el cielo vea que el legado esta bien encaminado,  seria la cúspide de la vida, Por ese amor a una carrera que ayudara a muchas personas pero que sobre todo le ayudara a surgir, quiere dar lo mejor de si para alcanzar eso que tanto anhela.
texts.en:
Angela is a brave person who is capable of overcoming great difficulties. Her son is her inspiration and the driving force in her life. She is convinced that studying with dedication and commitment is the first step for beginning a project, and that the first step of the stairway to success is to achieve economic stability, so that she can provide her son with all that he needs.

Angela wants to be a professional that any company would want. She loves life, dreams and the never-ending struggle to excel. She decided to study Cosmetology and Holistic Esthetics because she is certain that this is the career that will change her life, because of the workplace it entails and its concern for preserving beauty and all that this involves.

Angela has always been motivated by a desire to get ahead, but now is the moment in which the opportunity has presented itself, and this makes this Kiva loan to pay for a semester of tuition all the more necessary and timely, as it will provide her with security to continue studying. Angela has a very clear vision of where she wants to go, and she wants her son, father, sisters, brother and nephews to be proud of her, and she wants her mother to look down from heaven and see that her legacy is on the right path, which would be the pinnacle of her life. Angela wants to give the best of herself to achieve what she so desires, because of her love for a career that helps many people, but that above all will help her to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Joselyn Guadalupe

texts.es: Joselyn tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa de la  madre junto a su pequeño hijo de 2 meses. Es madre soltera y trabaja muy muro para colaborar con la economía del hogar y para llevar el sustento diario. Ella trabaja como empleada de una institución de su localidad. Se dedica a la elaboración de sopa de pata junto a su madre. De esta forma se gana la vida y va sacando lo necesario para su pequeño hijo. Desea apoyar a su familia con las mejoras de la vivienda la cual es muy sencilla. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila y para encementar el piso de la cocina. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava y hierro.
texts.en:
Joselyn is 20 years old and lives in her mother’s house with her little son who is two months old. She is a single mother who works very hard to contribute to the household finances and provide daily support.

She is employed by an establishment in her local area, where she works with her mother making sopa de pata (a traditional Salvadoran soup generally made with tripe, cow’s feet, yucca, plantains, corn, and other vegetables). In this way she  earns her living and provides for the needs of her little son. 

She wants to support her family with improvements to their home, which is very simple. For this reason she is seeking a loan from FUSAI, to invest in the construction of a pila (a concrete washing structure that includes a basin for holding water and one or two other basins for washing), and to put a concrete floor in the kitchen. 

With the requested amount she will purchase cement, sand, gravel and iron.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a washing area and to put a concrete floor in the kitchen.

loans.name: Hector Ulises

texts.es: Hector está agradecido con el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar herramientas para su trabajo ya que tiene su pequeño negocio de reparación  y pintado de avionetas y mantenimiento de instalaciones eléctricas; de esta manera podrá mejorar la atención a sus clientes y prestas un mejor servicio, así mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda y poder darle una profesión a su pequeña hija”.
texts.en:
Hector is grateful for the support that Kiva borrowers are offering to him. Thanks to their help, he will be able to buy tools for his job, since he has a small business doing repairs, painting light aircraft, and doing electrical maintenance work. With these tools he will be able to improve his customer care and offer better services. In this way, he will improve his earnings. 

Hector will continue to fight in order to make his dream a reality, that is, "Finishing the construction of his home and being able to give his young daughter a profession."

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Sora

texts.en:
Sora, 27 years old, is married with one child and is going to give birth to her second baby. Sora currently lives with her spouse and child in Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham province. To make a living, Sora has been doing farming and selling vegetables and meats in a local market. Having been in the business for years, she is able to earn approximately USD 5.00 per day to add to her husband’s income generated from the construction industry. 

Sora has been a client with HKL for one loan, which she used to buy supplies for her farming business. Likewise, as this will be her second her loan, she will buy a piece of land to expand her farming area. Sora hopes to have a fruitful harvest in the next coming season.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to expand her farming area.

loans.name: Lkhagva-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagva-Erdene, 33 years old, lives with his wife and 12-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a railway man for seven years, and in the same company, his wife cooks for employees. Their daughter goes to high school. 

The small house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation material, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam, for house renovation. After the house renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, and then fewer pollutants are released into the air. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Doris Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia Doris Antonia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende arroz,azucar,leche entre otros productos,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucra y leche.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member Doris Antonia continues to work on her grocery store business. She sells rice, sugar and milk, among other products. Doris has spent various years working on this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to grow the business. She is seeking this loan to purchase rice, sugar and milk. She is grateful for the loan she has been granted and she promises to comply with the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: María Nemesia

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad, no estudio, se casó hace tres años en la comunidad, pero vive con su pareja desde más de 30 años,  con su esposo han procreo 11 hijos,  5 varones y 6 hembras con quienes siempre trabajan en familia para ir saliendo adelante y así tener una mejor calidad de vida, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y sorgo) en su casa viven 6 hijos y tres nietos de quienes ella con su esposo están a cargo, los mayores ya tienen sus propias familias, pero siempre están pendientes.
Cuatro de sus hijos, actualmente están estudiando en la comunidad más cercana,  el cual tienen que viajar caminando durante 45 minutos, para llegar a la escuela donde reciben sus clases durante la semana.
María se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas,  desde los nueve años de edad, su madre le enseño el oficio de las artesanías, desde entonces ella hasta la fecha sigue elaborando hamacas para niños y para todas las edades, hace de seda y de poliseda pues le son rentables.
Ella compra los materiales en la ciudad más cercana, en el cual tiene que caminar durante 30 minutos para tomar el bus urbano, que la lleva durante otros treinta minutos hasta la ciudad, su esposa o sus hijos la acompañan para comprar los materiales, hace cuatro hamacas a la semana con la ayuda de su esposo y de sus hijos, sale a vender cada 15 o 22 días a la ciudad, pues en ese mercado las vende a mejor precio, también hace hamacas por encargos especiales. Trabaja durante todo el día desde las seis de la mañana hasta ya por la noche.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la compra de 200 libras de hilo de seda, el cual tiene un costo de $4.5 la libra.
Con ello tendrá materia prima para elaborar 40  hamacas de poliseda, las cuales espera venderla a buen precio para obtener ingresos económicos que le permitan darle a su familia el sustento.
El sueño de María es comprar un molino de moler maíz en la comunidad, para tener otra fuente de ingresos, ya que en el lugar donde vive no hay molino nixtamal, también con las ganancias de las ventas piensa seguir ayudándoles a sus hijos en los estudios para que se superen.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old. She did not go to school. She married three years ago in her community, but she has lived with her partner for more than 30 years. Her and her husband have 11 children,  5 sons and 6 daughters who always work together as a family to get ahead and  to obtain a better quality of life. Her husband works in agriculture (he plants corn, beans and sorghum). Six children and three grandchildren live in their home who Maria and her husband care for. The older children have their own families, but they are always close by. Four of their children are currently studying in the nearest community which is a 45 minute walk away to get to the school where they attend classes during the week. 

Maria works making hammocks. When she was 9 years old her mother taught her this artisanal trade. From this day on she continued to make hammocks for children and for people of all ages. She makes them out of silk and poliseda because they are profitable. She purchases the materials from the nearest city. To get there she has to walk for 30 minutes to take the municipal bus which takes another 30 minutes to arrive at the city. Her husband and her children accompany her to purchase the materials. She makes 4 hammocks per week with the help of her husband and her children. She leaves to sell them in the city every 15 to 22 days because they sell for a good price at the market. She also makes hammocks for special orders. Maria works during the entire day from six in the morning through to the night. The loan she is seeking is for the purchase of 200 pounds of silk which costs $4.50 per pound. With this silk she will have primary materials for 40 hammocks made from poliseda that she will sell for a good price to obtain earnings that will allow her to provide sustenance for her family. Maria's dream is to purchase a mill for grinding corn in town in order to have another source of income because in the area where they live there is no mill. Also, with the earnings from her sales she wants to continue assisting her children with their studies so they can succeed.

loans.use: to purchase 200 pounds of silk thread which costs $4.50 per pound.

loans.name: Malis

texts.en:
Malis is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a tourism agent who makes an income of $5 each day.

To improve her family’s livelihood, Malis is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase farmland for cultivating rice and vegetables. By doing so, she would be able to generate additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is 39 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Miriama has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, onions, salts, soy sauce, garlic and a large cooking pot. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Miriama will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, onions, salts, soy sauce, garlic and a large cooking pot.

loans.name: Kaiva

texts.en:
