Kaiva is a 57-year-old woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows cocoa to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Kaiva has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, a bush knife, gloves and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Kaiva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, a bush knife, gloves and shovels.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is 36 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community and has been doing this for three years. Sina has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, a large frying pan, salts, onions, soy sauce and a new oven. She joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sina will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, a large frying pan, salts, onions, soy sauce and a new oven.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is a 25-year-old woman who is married with one child. She has a small business, providing taxi service. Litia needs a loan to buy a spare tire, aseat cover, engine oil, breaks and fluid. She will use her profits to help her family's living situation and upgrade her business. Litia joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, a seat cover, engine oil, breaks and fluid.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, a 33-year-old resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and then selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to expand her product inventory, including groceries, toiletries, and beverages.

Lilia dreams that her variety store will become a grocery store and hopes that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Sroy

texts.en:
Sroy is 46 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $6 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are employed in a garment factory, and they earn about $16 each day. 

To improve her family’s finances, Sroy is requesting a loan of $1,000 (USD) to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service. This purchase will help him to generate additional income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and rebuild her house to make it much better for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Phy is 31 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $3 every day. 

To improve her farming business, Phy is requesting a loan of $1,200 (USD) to purchase fertilizer and rice seed to grow in the dry season. By doing so, she will earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business to help send her children to a good school. In addition, she wants to rebuild her house to make it bigger and much better for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzer and rice seed to grow in the dry season

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran is 41 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who makes an income of $1 per day. 

To improve her family’s finance, Saran is requesting a loan of $1,000 (USD) to purchase cattle to breed, producing calves to sell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed, producing calves to sell

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталье – 35 лет, она разведена. Она торгует на привокзальном рынке города Мелитополя мужской и женской обувью. Торговая точка у Натальи собственная, опыт работы – 10 лет.  
Сумма в 10 000 гривен Наталье нужна для того, чтобы закупить партию мужской и женской рабочей и комнатной обуви в ассортименте под реализацию. С прибыли она планирует развивать бизнес и улучшать благосостояние своей семьи.
texts.en: Natalya is 35 years old and divorced. She trades men's and women's shoes at a market by the train station in the town of Melitopol. Natalya has had her kiosk for ten years. She needs 10,000 UAH to stock up on men's and women's work shoes and slippers. With the profits Natalya plans to expand her business and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's footwear to resell.

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.ru:
Мамурчон занимается виноградарством и растениеводством. Ему 48 лет. Он с женой и тремя детьми живет в городе Турсунзаде. Мамурчон вот уже 12 лет выращивает виноград разных сортов. Его виноградная лоза расположена на большом участке земли, с которого он каждый год берет урожай. Доход с продажи виноград является главным источником дохода семьи. Ухаживать за виноградной лозой Мамурчону помогает жена и сын. 
Сейчас Мамурчон нуждается в кредите. Ему необходимо закупить арматуру, железо, металлические трубы, чтобы создать шпалеры для виноградника. Он надеется на финансовую поддержку кредиторов KIVA и заранее благодарит их.
texts.en:
Mamurjon grows grapes and other plants for a living.  He is 48, married and has three children.  They all live together in Tursun-zoda.  For 12 years, Mamurjon has been growing various kinds of grapes; selling grapes is his family's main source of income.  His grapevine is on a big plot of land.  He harvests grapes from his vine yearly and maintains it with help from his wife and son.  

Currently, Mamurjon is in need of a loan; he needs to buy supplies to make a trellis (rebar, iron, and metal pipes).  He is counting on Kiva's financial support, and would like to thank them in advance.

loans.use: buy rebar, iron and metal pipes to make a trellis for growing grape vines on

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en: Aiga is a 23-year-old woman who is married with one child. She has a small business, providing taxi service. Aiga needs a loan to buy a spare tire, a seat cover, fluid, steering oil, breaks and engine oil. She will use her profits to help her family living and upgrade her business. Aiga joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, a seat cover, fluid, steering oil, breaks and engine oil.

loans.name: Loimata

texts.en: Loimata is a 61-year-old married woman with six children. She runs a small business selling food at her canteen in her community and has been doing this for one year. Loimata has requested a loan to buy more chicken legs, taro, cooking oil, flour, onion, slats and a cooking pot. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Loimata will use her profit to improve her business and also her family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy more chicken legs, taro, cooking oil, flour, onion, slats and a cooking pot.

loans.name: Sharo

texts.en: Sharo is a 21-year-old woman who is married with one child. She plans to start a small business, running a taxi service. Sharo needs a loan to buy a spare tire, and brake and steering fluid. She will use her profits to pay her kids' education. Sharo joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, and brake and steering fluid.

loans.name: Leitulua

texts.en: Leitulua is a 43-year-old woman who is married and has 8 children. She has a small sewing business. She has many years with this business. Leitulua needs a loan to buy anew sewing machine, needles, threads and fabric. She will use her profits to improve her business. Leitulua joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, threads and fabric

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en: Mouena is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children. She runs a small business selling meat buns and pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Mouena has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, salt, onions, chicken, and a large cooking pot. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mouena will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, salt, onions, chicken, and a large cooking pot

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo is 68 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. He is married and blessed with 4 children. 

To earn a living, Raymundo has a restaurant business. He earns about 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Raymundo has requested a loan for the expansion of his restaurant business.

Raymundo has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Raymundo would like to expand his business with other locations throughout the city and continue to support his family specially the education of his children and their basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for the expansion of his restaurant business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 40 years old and lives in Maningcol, Ozamiz City. She is married and blessed with 3 children. 

To earn a living, Elsie has a Sari-sari store. She earns about 12,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Elsie has requested a loan for additional capital to buy merchandise to restock her store. 

Elsie has been a member of PMPC for less than a year.  In the future, Elsie would like to expand her business and continue to support her family specially the education of her children and their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Erdenesuvd

texts.en:
Erdenesuvd, 31 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a grocery store for eight months and before this, she worked as a sales representative at a private firm. Their elder son goes to high school while their younger son stays at his grandma's home. 

Erdenesuvd is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to buy foodstuffs in large amounts as a reserve. As a result, she will be able to run her grocery store without worrying about inventory shortages. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs in large amounts

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn runs a retail store selling groceries and also buys empty bottles in her community to make a living. She sells these empty bottles in town and she earns well doing this. She joined GDMPC recently and applied for a new loan to buy additional grocery goods and empty bottles to resell.  She hopes  to improve her business and wants to have a stable income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods and empty bottles to resell

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is a married woman and a mother of four teenage children from Bohol, Philippines.. Restituta has been in the fish vending business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Restituta is asking for a loan to buy additional fish stock to sell and to pay for the school expenses of her children. With this loan, she will be able to improve her fish stock and sales. In the future, Restituta hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell and to pay for school expenses

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат предприимчивая, коммуникативная и доброжелательная женщина из района Рудаки. Ей 30 лет. Она живет в доме с мужем, двухлетним ребенком, тетей и сестрой. Муж Саодат работает таксистом, а ребенок ходит в детский сад. 
Саодат два года как занимается выпечкой и торговлей. Она выпекает пирожки с разными начинками и затем продает в своей лавке. Ее бизнес хорошо продвигается. Чтобы привлечь больше клиентов, Саодату необходимо чтобы ее пирожки были всегда горячими. Чтобы реализовать это, Саодат обратилась за кредитом для покупки микроволновой печи. Кредит поможет ей увеличить количество клиентов и, естественно семейный доход тоже увеличится.
texts.en:
Saodat is an enterprising, communicative and friendly woman from the region of Rudaki. She is 30 years old and lives in a house with her husband and two-year-old child, aunt and sister. Saodat's husband works as a taxi driver, and their child goes to nursery school. 

For two years she has had a baking business. She makes pastries with various fillings and then sells them in her shop. Her business is going well. Saodat wants to attract a larger clientele by ensuring that her pasties are always hot. She wants to take a loan to buy a microwave oven. The loan will help her improve her customer base, and thus increase their family income.

loans.use: to buy a microwave oven.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting products.

loans.name: Bibisoro

texts.ru: Бибисоро простая сельская женщина в возрасте 45 лет. У нее муж, трое сыновей и двое дочерей, с которыми она живет в селе района Вахш. Бибисоро вот уже 10 лет как работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Ее муж и дети помогают ей в работе сельского хозяйства, так как у них большой участок земли. Бибисоро в основном занимается посевом пшеницы и хлопка. Она сейчас просит кредит, чтобы провести очередной посев. На сумму от кредита Бибисоро закупит семена пшеницы и минеральные удобрения. В дальнейшем за счет прибыли она планирует расширить орошаемый участок земли.
texts.en:
Bibisoro is simple 45-year-old country woman. Her husband has three sons and two daughters with whom she lives in the village district of Vakhsh. She has worked in an orchard for ten years. Her husband and children help her with the farming because they have a large plot of land. 

Bibisoro mainly farms wheat and cotton. She is asking for a loan to buy wheat seeds and fertilizer. In the future she plans to use the profits to expand their amount of irrigated land.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is from the village of San Marcelo and is known as a good citizen. She is 30 years old and happily married to Arnel, a father who works as a farmer. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with two children. Analyn is engaged in a rolling business. As of now, Analyn has inadequate capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase vegetables, meat and smoked fish to sell. She hopes to grow her business. In this way, she can provide her family's basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable, meat and smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Emerliza

texts.en:
Emerliza previously accessed a10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emerliza dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en:
Amgalan, 54 years old, lives with his wife in a traditional Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling) on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2004 and his decades of experience serve him well. His wife has the gift of fortune telling and lot of people visit her and give her some reward for the service. 

They have one son who studies at university in Korea and currently he is facing financial hardship and didn't pay his tuition fee. For this reason, Amgalan is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to pay for his son's tuition fees. He thinks the best investment he can make for his son is to help him acquire his needed education.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition fees

loans.name: Batkhuyag

texts.en:
Batkhuyag is 45 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been transporting goods between districts by truck. His wife distributes drinking water to local people. Their elder daughter currently works as seller at a trade center. 

Batkhuyag is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy planks, bricks and cement for building a barn attached to his ger. The barn will serve as protection against the cold and possibly decrease the consumption of coal. The burning of coal is the main source of air pollution in Ulaanbaatar according to the state research institute.

loans.use: to buy planks, cement and bricks

loans.name: Dúo Diciembre Alegre Group

texts.es:
Dúo Diciembre Alegre
Este dúo esta conformado por Marleni ellas es madres de familia y se dedica a tejer fajas típicas así como también a vender lácteos, es el primer crédito que solicita a kiva, ya que para este fin de mes invierte mas mercaderia ya que es en esta época cuando mas se vende, ellas promete pagar puntualmente en cada pago, para que en otra oportunidad kiva les pueda ayudar con un crédito nuevamente, para su negocio.
texts.en: The "Diciembre Alegre" (Happy December) duo includes Marleni. She is the mother of a family and weaves traditional skirts. She sells dairy products as well. This is the first loan that she has solicited from Kiva, since at the end of this month she will invest in more merchandise, because this is the time when she sells the most. She promises to be punctual with every payment so that on another occasion Kiva can help them with a new loan for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a married woman and mother of a four-year-old daughter from Bohol, Philippines. She runs a bakery at her place. This is the source of her income. Rizalina wants to improve her business but lacks the financial resources to do so.

Rizalina is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients and materials for baking such as flour, yeast, milk, sugar and flavoring. In the future, Rizalina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for baking

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 36-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of six children. She belongs to an ultra poor family, and sometimes it seems impossible for her to feed her entire family three times in a day. Her husband provides white wash services. He has to sit in  front of a paint dealer’s shop so he can easily find new customers and sometimes he does not find any customers. Her husband has a new contract for white wash services but he does not have tools to provide the service.

Rasheeda requested a loan so that her husband will be able to buy new paintbrushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc.

Her husband’s income is very small, which is why her family passes their lives in miserable conditions. She wants to change this condition for her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her.

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools for providing white wash services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy space to open a produce store.

loans.name: Poh Gending Lestari Group

texts.en:
The Poh Gending Permai group repaid their loan. The repayment was made by the head of the group, Ni Nengah, because most of the members work at the garden. During the loan period, all the members sold their pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. With the knowledge from the training they had, they can manage the pigs well now.

Ni Nengah sold all her pigs. With the profit she earned, she was able to save and renovate her kitchen, although not so much. But, she’s very happy and decided to borrow a new loan to increase her business. She said thanks to the lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business.

Entering the fourth loan, the group received a larger loan amount. Most of the members of Poh Gending Lestari group have sows and local pigs for pig barbeque. The local pigs are sold every two months.

As the head, Ni Nengah set a good example for her friends. Now she plans to purchase super quality piglets. Besides the pig business, Ni Nengah has a small kiosk now and she will use part of the loan to purchase merchandise. She will sell the piglets after fattening. She’s really happy and thankfull to Kiva, MUK and the lenders for supporting her business and the group. Now she can add to her husband’s income to fullfill their daily needs.

loans.use: To buy super quality piglets and merchandise for her kiosk

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl previously accessed a loan of 9,000 PHP that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Sheryl would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sheryl hopes that her business will continue and dreams to give her family a good future.  She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Victoria Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Victoria tiene 42 años de edad. Originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de tortillería. Inicio este negocio hace cuatro años, palmeando con poco maíz; haciéndoles tortillas a sus vecinos.  Luego, poco a poco iba realizando más tortillas, ya que le pareció rentable y demandado. Actualmente cuenta con su negocio próspero y productivo. Su meta próxima es comprar maíz por mayor. Solicita un crédito para comprar: maíz, cal, leña. Con el fin de mantener una buena elaboración de tortillas. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a incrementar la producción de su producto y poder abastecer con los pedidos de su clientela. Su plan futuro es seguir adelante con sus proyectos.
texts.en: Doña Victoria is 42 years old. She is a native of the city of Esteli. She is married and the mother of two children. She works in commerce, in a tortilla business. She began this business four years ago, shaping a little corn to make tortillas for her neighbors. Then, little by little, she produced more tortillas, since it appeared to her that [the business] was profitable and [her tortillas] were in demand. Now she has a prosperous and productive business. Her next goal is to buy corn wholesale. She is applying for a loan to buy corn, lime, and firewood, with the goal of maintaining a good production of tortillas. She considers that the loan will help her to increase the production of her products and to deliver the orders of her customers. Her future plan is to continue forward with her projects.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and firewood.

loans.name: Vaatauomalo

texts.en: Vaatauomalo is a 22-year-old single lady with no children. She runs a small business selling snacks and finger foods, etc., in her community and has been doing this for three years.Vaatauomalo has requested a loan to buy snacks, salts, sugar, rice, chicken, soft drinks and onions. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vaatauomalo will help her family in every need.

loans.use: to buy snacks, salts, sugar, rice, chicken, soft drinks and onions.

loans.name: Adiya

texts.en: Mr. Adiya is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He provides taxi service to local people for a living. His wife currently stays at home, looking after their infant son. Using his previous loan, he purchased furniture and then created a comfortable living environment for his family. Now he is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to buy bricks, cement and planks in order to build a barn, attached to his ger (portable felt dwelling). The barn will halt heat loss through the door and possibly reduce coal consumption. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and planks.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Victoria se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pollipapas (papas fritas con pollo frito),la socia ya tiene buen tiempo en este negocio y le va muy bien,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pollipapas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos y papas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Victoria continues to sell “pollipapas” (fried chicken with fried potatoes).  She has been doing this for some time and things are going very well for her.  She gets her children ahead through her business and wants to expand it.  She is asking for this loan to buy chicken and potatoes.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chicken and potatoes.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia Marina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende chompas,chalinas y guantes,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar artesania como chompas,guantes y chalinas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Marina is continuing her artesian business.  She sells sweaters, shawls, and gloves and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  She has been doing this for several years and things are going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her artesian business and is asking for a loan to buy items such as sweaters, gloves, and shawls.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to by merchandise.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 36 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen un tres hijos de 13, 11 y  de 5 años, la mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su marido es agricultor.
Doña María es una gran madre y esposa que realiza el crédito para su negocio como para que su marido lo utilice en su trabajo, el es agricultor y siempre en la época invernal siembra maíz, maní y verduras, para esto el requiere de capital para comprar semillas, insecticidas y para pagara mano de obra, ella por su parte tiene un pequeño galpón en el cual cría pollos. Así es como ellos luchan para que a sus pequeños no les falte nada.
Este crédito es para comprar semillas, insecticidas y alimento para los pollos. Este es su quinto ciclo y esta muy contenta con los créditos. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizonte credit group is located in the “24 De Mayo” area of the Manabí province.  This area is known for its beautiful landscapes and hardworking people dedicated to agriculture and raising livestock.

Maria lives here.  She is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children, ages 13, 11, and 5.  The oldest attends high school and the two younger ones attend school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Maria is a wonderful mother and wife who is asking for this loan so that her husband can use it in his business.  He is a farmer and raises corn, peanuts, and vegetables.  He needs money to buy seeds, insecticides, and pay for labor.  She, herself, has a small chicken coop and raises chickens.  This is how they struggle so that their children will not be in need of anything.

This loan is to buy seeds and chicken feed.  This will be her fifth cycle and she is happy about the loans.  Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman and a mother of three grown-up children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the fishing business for more than 25 years. Her husband works as a fisherman.

As of now, Milagros needs additional capital for their fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and for the repair and maintenance of their fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, giving them more fish to sell. In the future, Milagros hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to repair and maintain the fishing boat

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman and a mother of three children aged 15, 10 and 7 from the town of Panglao, Bohol. 

Magdalena earns a living through her sewing business. She has been in this venture for more than 20 years now. Magdalena is asking for a loan to buy materials such as cloth, thread, needles and other materials for sewing. Through this, she will be able to sew more and accept more orders for repairs from her customers. In the future, Magdalena hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing such as cloth, thread, needles and other materials

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain his Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and maintain his Jeepney unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Joey hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that all his children will finish their education. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from his study of the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney vehicle

loans.name: Shohzoda

texts.ru: Шохзода профессиональный пекарь лепешек. Ей 22 года, она живет с родителями и сестрой в Б.Гафуровском районе города Худжанд. Шохзода с 14 лет работает в пекарне и уже 8 лет как она занимается выпечкой традиционных таджикских лепешек. У нее очень вкусно получается, потому что она относится к выпечке с большой любовью. До сегодняшнего дня Шохзода работала в пекарне в качестве работника и сейчас она собирается заняться этим делом самостоятельно. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить муку и уголь для выпечки лепешек. Место уже она себе нашла, остается только закупить сырье и приступить к делу. Шохзода с нетерпением ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
Shohzoda is a professional baker of flat breads. She is 22 years old and lives with her parents and sister in Ghafurov District, Khujand. Shohzoda has been working at the bakery since she was 14 years old; she has spent the last 8 years baking traditional Tajik bread. Her baking is very good because she does it with a lot of love.

Until today, Shohzoda has been working at a bakery; now, she plans to open her own. She is requesting the loan in order to buy flour and coal for baking. She has already found a space, so all she has to do is buy the materials and get started. Shohzoda eagerly awaits your assistance.

loans.use: to buy flour and coal for baking

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is 46 years old, and a married woman with 4 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes, donuts, and pies in her community and has been doing this for two years. Mareta has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, onion, slats, cooking oil and a large cooking pot. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mareta will provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, onion, slats, cooking oil and a large cooking pot.

loans.name: Ana Daisy

texts.es: Ana de 37 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 16 y 7 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de artículos de belleza como: lociones, cremas, maquillaje y calzado. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad, y gracias a su carisma ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Desea invertir en la compra mayor inventario para su negocio, para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar: maquillaje, lociones, cremas, calzado, joyería, etc. para incrementar el inventario y así aumentar las ventas con el fin de poder percibir mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana, who is 37 years old, lives in her own house together with her life companion and their two children, ages 16 and 7. She sells beauty products such as lotions, creams, makeup, and footwear. She makes her sales as a street vendor in the principal zones of her area, and thanks to her charisma, she has succeeded in winning the confidence of many customers, who prefer her more every day. She wants to invest in the purchase of more inventory for her business, for which she is applying to FUSAI for this loan to buy makeup, lotions, creams, footwear, jewelry, etc., to increase her inventory and thus increase her sales, with the goal of being able to earn greater income.

loans.use: to buy makeup, lotions, creams, footwear, and jewelry, etc., to sell

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VILLA QUIQUIJANA,la socia es la Sra. Martina tiene 50 años de edad tiene 07 hijos y es separada; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de picanteria,la socia vende diferentes tipos de platos como cuy al horno,chicharron,lechon(plato hecho a base de chancho),entre otros, la socia también vende cerveza y chicha, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cerveza para su negocio.

Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de comida, picanteria, tienda de abarrotes, venta de granos, venta de ropa, farmacia, maestro constructor.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is a member of the “VILLA QUIQUIJANA” communal bank.  Martina is 50 years old, is separated and has seven children.  She has a restaurant where she sells different types of dishes such as baked goods, fried pork rinds, “lechon” (a dish made from pork), and other things.  She also sells beer and chicha and has been doing this for a good amount of time; things are going well for her thanks to the daily efforts she puts in.  She is a responsible and hardworking woman who wants to keep working and supporting her family.

She needs a loan to buy beer for her business.

The other members sell food, have grocery stores, sell grains, sell clothing, have a pharmacy, and teach.

The members in the attached photos could not attend the meeting due to work commitments.

The person with her face covered is not part of the communal bank.

This member is grateful for the support and promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky runs a cafeteria to sell meals to make a living. He has done this more than a year and he is able to earn money to meet the family needs. He became a member of GDMPC this current year and requests a loan to purchase raw ingredients to use in his cafeteria. He hopes to increase his income to further educate his three children.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make meals for his cafeteria business.

location.town: Gulayon, Dipolog  City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 48 years old and lives in Baybay Maningcol, Ozamiz City. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Emma has a business selling rice cakes and other snacks foods. She earns about PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. Emma has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Emma would like to have a stall for her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Empenita

texts.en:
Empenita is 54 years old and lives in Baybay Maningcol, Ozamis City. She is married with three children.

Empenita has a shop that sells cellphone accessories. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to buy accessories and other materials for her cellphone repair business. Empenita has been a member of PMPC for half a year. In the future, Empenita hopes to expand her business and save more money.

loans.use: to buy accessories and other materials for her cellphone repair business.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is 47 years old and lives in Sebasi Clarin. She is married with four children and one school-aged child.

Epefania has a sari-sari store where she earns approximately 5,000 per month. She's been doing this for almost 8 years. This business helps her to support her family. Now she is applying for a loan to purchase canned goods and other grocery items.

She's been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and other grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Angelica Natali

texts.es: Angelica esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar enseres para su hogar y poder re faccionar las paredes de su vivienda, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sobre todo por su hija de 8 años,  a la cual quiere mucho, así seguirá trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija y poder tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en: Angelica is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the support that they have offered her she will buy furnishings for her home and be able to repair the walls of her home. In this way she will be able to improve the quality of life of her family and above all for her daughter, who is eight years old and whom she loves very much. Thus she will continue working and striving to make a reality of her great dream: to give her daughter a profession and be able to have her own business.

loans.use: to buy furnishings and repair walls

loans.name: Barodboy

texts.ru: Добрый человек из отдаленного региона, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Его зовут Бародбой. Ему 54 года. Он женат. Его жена занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Его дети совершеннолетние. Он воспитывает 2 не совершеннолетних внуков. Так как он живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность развивать свой бизнес, скотоводством. Он более 25 лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Он хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки скота для пополнения оборотного капитала. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условию проживания. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This kind person from a remote region is in need of financial assistance. His name is Barodboy, he is 54 years old, and is married. His wife grows agricultural crops, and his children are grown up. Barodboy is also raising two young grandchildren.

Since he lives in a rural area, Barodboy has a good chance of growing his cattle breeding business. He has been raising cattle for over 25 years and has a lot of experience in this sector. Thanks to the good condition of his cattle, he has regular customers. Barodboy plans to grow his business and increase his income. He is requesting a loan of 15000 somoni to buy cattle and expand his working capital; he will use the resulting income to improve his living conditions. He appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle and increase working capital.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan also helped in the education of her child while her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennie hopes that her business will last longer, and dreams to be prosperous in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is when she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.ru: Саидмурод проживает в отдаленном кишлаке.  Саидмурод имеет большую семью. У него трое не совершеннолетних детей и пожилая мать.  Он в основном занимается  животноводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур. В полевых работах ему в основном помогает жена Гулнора. Саидмурод обратился  в нашу организацию в 3– ий раз. Бизнес начинал с двух голов мелкого рогатого скота и в данное время он имеет 4 голов крупно рогатого скота. Он откармливает скот и продает его на мясо мясникам и на доходы от этого направления бизнеса вкладывает в улучшение жилищных условий на содержание семьи. Саидмурод  хочет пополнить оборотный капитал и с такой целью он запрашивает займ на сумму 12000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Saidmurod lives in a remote village. He has a large family. He has three underage children and also his elderly mother [in his care]. He mainly raises livestock and grows produce. His wife, Gulnora, is the one who mostly helps him with growing produce. This is the third time that Saidmurod is turning to our organization. He launched his business by having two heads of small livestock, and now he has four heads of cattle. He fattens cattle for resale to butchers. He uses the revenue from this business to support his family and improve their living conditions. Saidmurod would like to replenish his working capital, which is why he is applying for a loan in the amount of 12,000 TJS to buy cattle. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to increase his working capital in order to buy cattle.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño Jesús 2 está integrado por 20 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas que están formando parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza de la fundación paraguaya.
Ursulina es parte de este grupo, ella vio una gran oportunidad de poder crecer en este grupo, es por eso que decidió unirse a ellas. Ursulina se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, y por medio de su modesto trabajo ayuda a su familia y cubre las necesidades de su casa, es una persona modesta, pero que lucha por mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas varias para la venta, como ser gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás, para seguir con su venta y poder mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
“Divino Niño Jesús 2” is made up of 20 women, all friends and neighbors who form part of the la Fundación Paraguaya elimination of poverty program. 

Ursulina is part of this group and she saw a great opportunity to grow with this group, so she decided to join.  Ursulina sells beverages of all types and helps her family and covers their needs through her modest work.  She is a modest person but strives to improve.

She is asking for this loan to buy beverages, such as soft drinks, wine, beer, and others to sell and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
Cerelyn is married with 2 children. She is 29 years old and lives in Pantaon,Ozamiz City.

Cerelyn earns a living by operating her sari-sari store.  She has had this business for 5 years and earns 45,000 PHP each month. She requests a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages, soft drinks, sack of rice, etc.

Cerelyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Cerelyn hopes to save money for their future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sacks of rice , beverages, soft drinks, etc. for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 68-year-old widow with 7 children. She lives in Baybay Maningcol,Ozamiz City.

Virginia earns a living by operating her sari-sari store.  She has had this business for 20 years and  earns 21,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan for 15,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, soft drinks, sacks of rice, etc.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Virginia hopes to save money for her future.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari business.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en: Arlinda is 60 years old and lives in Sebasi Clarin.  She is married with eight children.  Arlinda has a retail business, earning approximately 2,000 a month.  She's been doing this for almost three years.  This business helps her to support her family.  She is now applying for a loan to buy new ready-to-wear products to sell.  She's been a member of PMPC for almost four years.

loans.use: to buy new ready-to-wear products to sell.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en: Ailene is 38 years old and married with 3 children.  She lives in Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Ocidental. Her husband is a fisherman and they have a fishing business. She requests a loan to buy fishing materials. She has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials needed for her fishing business.

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 61-year-old hard working mother who resides in the Lala-o, San Juan, Siquijor, Philippines. She has 2 children and is married to a carpenter.  The wage that her husband earns isn’t enough to meet the family's daily needs. So, Lourdes started a food stand or “carenderia”  business more than a year ago. 

Lourdes wants to expand her food stand business .  She wants to make enough profit to sustain her family, especially her children.  She would like to be able to send her son to college. In order for Lourdes to make her wish possible, she needs 14,900 PHP and will use the money to expand her business.  She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things needed in the food stand. 

She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as vegetables, fish and meat.

loans.name: Nery Ursula

texts.es: Nery esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando ella podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes para su cultivo y también poder comprar semillas para poder seguir sembrado su parcela de cultivo, de esta manera podrá dar un buen mantenimiento a su cultivo y tener una buena cosecha y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en: Nery is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help that they are offering her, she will be able to buy compost and fertilizers for her crops, and she will also be able to buy seeds to be able to continue planting her parcel of crops. In this way she will be able to give good maintenance to her crops and have a good harvest  and be able to improve her income. Thus she will be able to offer a better quality of life to her family and continue striving to make a reality of her great dream: to finish building her home.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and other supplies

loans.name: Bhauraba

texts.en:
Bhauraba is a 23-year-old  differently-able man living with his parents and one younger brother in Odisha, a state in Eastern India. He has owned a small grocery shop in his village for the past three years and also does paddy cultivation on his family’s land. From both the activities, he manages to make 3,000 INR per month. His father is a daily laborer and is able to earn 6,000 INR a month for the family while his brother is still studying in school, and also helps Bhauraba to bring grocery items from the main market. Bhauraba gives his earnings to his father to help with the monthly household expenses and to take care of the fields.

He would like to become more independent and support his parents more, so he would like to start purchasing the grocery items in bulk quantity to avoid the high purchase price and earn a higher profit.  Additionally, he would like to purchase a fridge for the shop so he can sell cold drinks and perishable items. Bhauraba has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing the refrigerator, cold drinks, and bulk items such as sugar, edible oil, rice, flour, biscuits, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a refrigerator, cold drinks, and bulk items such as sugar, edible oil, rice, flour, biscuits etc. for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother of four children; three children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (brothers).   

She has restaurant business; she has been in this business for 11 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, and rice. 

She generates additional income from selling vegetables like cabbages and fresh peas.  She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters.  

She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant with a fridge so as to start selling soft drinks and  also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent .

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, rice and beef

loans.name: Fredy Antonio

texts.es: Fredy de 34 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. Fredy se dedica a la reparación de prendas de oro desde hace mucho tiempo. Tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Fredy desea terminar de construir un cuarto para sus hijos ya que su vivienda es muy pequeña y no es muy cómodo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, grava, cemento, hierro y arena para dar final al cuarto dormitorio para sus hijos.
texts.en: Fredy is 34 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife and two children, ages 4 and 2.  Fredy has been repairing gold jewelry for a long time.  He has lots of experience in the business because he has many customers.  Fredy wants to finish building a room for his children because his house is very small and not very comfortable.  He is asking for a loan through FUSAI so he can buy bricks, gravel, cement, iron bars, and sand to finish his children’s bedroom.

loans.use: to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Dúo Gloria A Dios Group

texts.es:
Duo Gloria A Dios
Este dúo lo conforman Janehira Noemi ella se dedica a elaborar tejidos y bordados típicos, ella necesita comprar hilos, telas y materiales para seguir tejiendo ya que tiene pedidos y necesita comprar producto por mayor para conseguir un buen precio. El sueño de ella es abrir una tienda en donde pueda vender y exponer sus propios tejidos y esperan que Fape y Kiva las ayude a cumplir sus sueños para asi ayudar a sus familias a tener un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Duo Gloria A Dios

This duo includes Janehira Noemi.  She does typical weaving and embroidery and needs to buy thread, fabric, and supplies because she has orders and needs to buy products in quantity to get a good price.  Her dream is to open a store where she can sell and display her own weavings and she hopes that FAPE and Kiva will help her achieve her dreams so they can help their families have better incomes.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 64 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with 3 children. 

Mario operates an restaurant business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month. He requests a loan to purchase additional amounts of meat, beef, chicken and spices for his business. 

Mario has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Mario hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of meat, beef, chicken and spices.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma lives in Pasihagon, Siquijor, Siquijor, Philippines.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a fisherman who never tires of supporting their big family. 

In 2012, she applied her membership to Paglaum MPC because of all the benefits available to members.  She continues to be a credible member in good standing and always pays her loans in a timely manner. 

She asks for a loan of 10,000 PHP for additional capital for the fishing business.  She makes use of torn foam in their fish nets and hopes to buy new ones. Through this project, she plans to earn more income and help to expand the business.  

Emma has found comfort in meeting their financial needs through Paglaum MPC, of which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials such as fishing nets.

loans.name: Aida Rosemary

texts.en:
Aida Rosemary is a 48-year-old married woman with five children living in Masindi, Uganda. She owns a bar along a busy market street and owns rentals as additional income. She started this business so that she can meet her family's basic needs, including educating her children. She faces challenges of limited capital for expansion and customers who don't pay her on time. Her dream is to educate her children to higher institutions of learning and also to construct more rentals to increase her income.

Aida Rosemary requests a loan to buy soda, beer and spirits to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer and spirits to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a widow who  makes a living with her retail business. She sells selected grocery items and food in her little stall and earns enough money to meet her basic needs. She joined GDMPC and requests a loan to purchase additional grocery goods like canned goods and noodles. 

She plans to build a shelter where she could sell her goods comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods like canned goods and noodles.

location.town: San Pedro Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is 25 years old and single. He lives in  Mabini Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Vincent has operated an online games and internet cafe business for 3 years and earns a monthly income of 14,000 PHP. He requests a loan to purchase another computer unit. He is a good member and a business-minded person.

loans.use: to purchase 1 computer unit.

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en: Mr. Enkhtur, 44 years old, lives alone in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently he works as a watchman at a private firm and before this job, he had provided taxi services to local people for eleven years. Using his previous loan, he installed a low pressure furnace into his house, which resulted in a warmer and more comfortable environment for living. This time, he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tughrik) to buy a computer. He will use the computer to prepare documents, search for better paying jobs and get information on society. Mr. Enkhtur is a very hardworking individual who is looking for opportunities to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past six years. 

She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is motivated to provide for her family. 
As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan to buy stocks of rice, flour, and sugar from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase her business capital. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: To buy inventories for her general store.

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.en:
Hechong runs a tea stall at the centre of the town market, which is about 40 kms from Imphal town. The shop has an immense advantage in earning as it is located close to the town parking shed. Tired and exhausted travelers usually drop in for a cup of tea to start off and she also tries her best to give good customer service. She is the featured borrower member for Esther Group and she is pictured with her hand raised.

Hechong opens the shop early in the morning and usually closes down before the sunset. Her business peak time is early morning and at noon time. Her tea stall is a success and she is earning well. The generated income is insufficient for the family as she also takes care of her husband's nieces and nephew who were unfortunately abandoned by their father.
  
She is striving hard together with her husband to manage the family expenses and also to stand as a financially independent woman.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more sacks of flour and wheat, and also juices and cold drinks to sell. The burden of rolling out the capital money for investment has been fulfilled by Kiva and she is very glad. Earlier, she used to get capital money from local money investors with high interest rates. 

She says she will try her best to expand the shop and make more income to support the family and give good education for the children.

The rest of the group members are engaged in poultry, weaving, selling  garments, and running a tea stall.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of flour and wheat, and also juices and cold drinks for the tea stall.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael es originario de la ciudad de Wiwili, Jinotega. De 32 años de edad, padre soltero de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Negocio que inicio hace varios años, el cual con poco y mucho esfuerzo  dinero decide instalar su pulpería. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio estable y rentable. Su meta es apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios. Solicita un crédito para comprar: papel higiénico, arroz, azúcar, detergentes, sodas, frijoles, entre otros, con el fin de mantener surtido sus productos. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que aumentara sus ventas y obtener buenas ganancias. Su plan futuro es seguir luchando con esfuerzos para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y ayudarlos a que estudien en la universidad.
texts.en: Ismael is originally from the city of Wiwili, Jinotega. She is 32 years old and a single father of 3 children. He is a merchant and is in the grocery store business for a living. He began the business some years ago. With little money and much strength he decided to install his grocery store. Today he says his business is stable and profitable. He goal is to support his children with their studies. He is requesting a loan to purchase: toilet paper, rice, sugar, detergents, sodas, beans, etc. with the goal of keeping his products stocked. He says that the credit will be beneficial as he will grow his sales and obtain good earnings. His future plan is to continue struggling for his children to have a better quality of life and help them to study in college.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, rice, sugar, detergents, sodas, beans, etc.

loans.name: Jayasen

texts.en:
Jayasen is a 35-year-old differently abled man residing with his wife and daughter in a village in Odisha, a state on the Eastern coast of India. He suffers from paralysis on the left side of his body, but this has not prevented him from working hard to support his family. For the past 13 years, he has been running a small shop in the market near where he lives, selling snacks and the very popular local Betel nut. His wife often helps him with the shop while their daughter attends the local school.

Jayasen would now like to expand his business to be a full variety shop, with basic household items and packaged snacks. This would allow him to increase his income and better support his family. For years several years now, they have been saving money for this expansion, accumulating 40,000 INR. However, because of his disability, Jayasen has had difficulty getting the final financing he needs to make his dreams a reality. 

Now, he is asking for a loan from Kiva for the final 10,000 INR he needs to meet his budget. As he is still living in a rented house, he hopes the extra income he will earn from the new shop will allow him to save enough money for his family to invest in a house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase basic household items and packaged snacks to sell

loans.name: Nazish Tanveer

texts.en:
Nazish is a 24-year-old hard working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband, daughter, and son. Her husband is a tailor by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past 3-years, in addition to tailoring, he has been driving a taxi. Currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. 

Nazish, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit her husband wants to open a new tailoring shop in the future. Nazish desires to provide a quality education to her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to pay to repair her husband's taxi engine

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet, a single mother of two children, is an enterprising woman.She started a garments business five years ago because of her love for fashion and also to get money to meet the needs of her children, being a single mother. 

She has seen has business transform and to improve it she has been acquiring loans from Ugafode to boost the business. This being festive season, she wants a loan to buy a stock of fashionable trends to attract a large corporate class to her business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Geralda

texts.en:
Geralda is 64 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 

Geralda has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products.  She earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month. She requests a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

Geralda has been a member of PMPC for 13 years.  In the future Geralda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Fadhil, who is in his early 30s, is a divorcee with two children who are still going to school. He is staying with his young brother who is still at school. He has been running a general store for eight years now. He works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Fadhil's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle, open another general store and buy items for his general stores. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loans. He used the profits to pay the school fees and cover his household expenses. He will use this loan to buy inventory and meet his customers' demands. He dreams of becoming an international businessman.

Fadhil will share this loan with his loan group Iringa, whose members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy inventory and meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 42 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Merlie raises hogs and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month. She requests a loan to purchase building materials like hollow blocks, cement and nails for house repairs and renovations. 

Merlie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for house repairs and renovations.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 60-year-old widow who lives in Lupagan,Clarin,Philippines. She has 5 children. 

To earn a living, Lina has a food stall business and sells food in the community. She earns about 3,500 PHP each month. Lina requests a loan to buy spices and ingredients for her business.

Lina has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Lina would like to support her family members.

loans.use: to buy spices and ingredients for her food stall business.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a 42-year-old married woman with 4 children. She lives in Pan-ay,Clarin,Philippines.

Marife sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. She requests a loan for 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Marife has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Marife hope to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a water dispenser and a gas cooker

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a 50-year-old married man with eight children. Lucas runs a hardware shop in Nyarukiika trading centre. He has been doing this business for 10 years. He started this business because of the high demand in the village. Lucas has been able to make good sales and was able to send his children to school and buy himself a car since there is less competition in the area where his business is located. 

He applied for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX so that he can buy building materials in form of cement, lime, timber and paint to furnish his residential house that is in bad shape in preparation of the festive season and use a portion of it to pay tuition for his children. 

He is a very hardworking and honest man.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, timber, and paint to furnish his residential house

loans.name: Viriasi

texts.en:
Viriasi lives in rural Lyantonde with his family.  Farming is his main source of income and livelihood.  He grows different food crops including cassava to eat as well as to sell.  He needs a loan in order to pay for a piece of land that he will use for farming next to him so that he can increase his productivity and also his profits.  

In the photograph Viriasi is pictured with the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: to pay for a piece of land that he will use for farming.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is a third-time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance applying for Ugx 3,000,000.  He is a married man with three children that he cares for, with the help of his wife. He runs a small wholesale shop at his home in the outskirts of the city.  It is this shop that has helped him be to able to feed and educate his children as well as paying rent for his shop and home. Cosmas’ major challenge is small working capital that is hindering him from making big sales that would generate more profits. 

Given the loan, he would like to restock the shop so he can eventually see his sales grow and thus earn more profits and also be able to meet all his customers’ demand.

Cosmas also hopes to buy a piece of land where he will able to put up house for his family now that his children are grown up.

loans.use: To buy stock to sell in wholesale shop

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 35-year-old man with one child from one of the villages in Ibanda. His child attends school. He runs a piggery project where he earns income to look after his family. He started this piggery business because he wanted to increase his level of income. He has been able to make good sales since there is less competition in the area where the business is located. 

He would like a loan of 2,500,000= so that he can buy more piglets that he will rear and the sell at a higher value when they have grown and also to construct an improved sty for his pigs. He also hopes to construct a permanent house for his children.
Charles is a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy baby pigs and to construct an improved sty.

loans.name: Stheyse Jhanneth

texts.es: Stheyse está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar utensilios para su negocio como ollas, envases de plástico, cucharitas, bolsas, sillas  entre otros, con lo cual podrá mejorar la atención a sus clientes y de esta manera poder mejorar su negocio y mejorara su ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando por sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 2 meses de edad y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener una casa propia y poder darle una vida digna a su hijo”.
texts.en: Stheyse is grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to their help she has been able to buy supplies for her business, such as pots, plastic containers, spoons, bags, chairs, and other things that will allow her to provide better service to her customers and improve her business and income in this way.  She will continue striving to get her two month old son ahead and work to make her dream a reality, “To have home of her own and provide a dignified life to her son.”

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
This is Maxima, 48, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married and she has children. She, together with her children, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Maxima operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and foods cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippine Pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables, and products needed in her business.

Maxima hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT (Center for Community Transformation) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a 52-year-old married woman.

Her financial condition is not good; her son drives a moto rickshaw. This rickshaw is being driven over local roads to cover small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to withstand jerks over roads. Now the rickshaw’s body needs to be replaced because it rattles during driving. This is the reason she wants to buy a new body for the moto rickshaw.
 
She requested a loan so that her son can maintain the rickshaw body so that he can drive it smoothly. 

Zarina thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw body for her son.

loans.name: Akuwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bijoux et pagnes au marché, Madame Akuwa est une dame âgée de 50ans. Elle a en charge des enfants. Il y a un moment qu’elle fait des opérations financières à WAGES et elle est à son quatrième crédit dans notre institution. Les trois derniers ont été payés avec succès. Ce montant qu’elle sollicite lui servira à s’approvisionner en bijoux et pagnes. Avec les profits, elle veut investir dans l’activité, devenir grossiste de bijoux et de pagnes et permettre à ses petits enfants de s’épanouir.
texts.en: Akuwa, age 50, has been selling jewelry and pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) at the market since 1996. She supports some children. She has been a member of WAGES for some time, and she is currently seeking a fourth loan from the micro-finance institution. The first three loans were repaid successfully. This new credit will allow her to stock up on jewelry and pagnes. She plans to use the profits earned to reinvest in her activity, become a wholesaler of jewelry and pagnes, and ensure her children’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Jesus Group

texts.es: Dúo Jesus la señora Humbertina de Jesus quien se dedica a la venta de shampoo  por litro,y por galon, también desinfectante, que son preparados por ella misma. Talento que desempeña por enseñanzas de grupos para las mujeres con deseo de superación, Las fiestas navideñas están cerca y ella ya tiene varios pedidos de champo pero necesita comprar materiales como flores, esencias y colorantes para prepararlos y el dinero no le alcanza por tal motivo necesita un crédito para no quedarles mal a sus clientes, esperando que le puedan ayudar en su negocio.
texts.en: Humbertina de Jesus is part of this duo and sells shampoo by the liter and by the gallon.  She also sells disinfectant that she makes.  She learned this from women’s groups who want to succeed.  The Christmas festivals are nearing and she has several shampoo orders but she needs to buy supplies such as flowers, essences, and colorants to prepare them but she did not have enough money and needs a loan so as not to disappoint her customers.  She hopes that you can help her with her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another mill to better serve customers

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es: Zeneyda tiene 29 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo. Originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Negocio que inicio hace varios años; anteriormente trabajaba en una fábrica. Pero deseaba tener su propio negocio, así que, con el dinero de su liquidación instala su pulpería. Hoy en día cuenta con su propio local prospero. Su meta próxima es mejorar las condiciones de su casa. Solicita un crédito para comprar: arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, pan, gaseosas, jabones, entre otros, con el fin de aumentar sus productos más solicitado por sus clientes.
