Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofertar sus productos aumentando sus ventas e incrementando sus ganancias. Su plan futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio y comprando más productos.
texts.en: Zeneyda is 29 years old, married, and has a son.  She is from Esteli, is a merchant, and has a store which she started several years ago.  She used to work at a factory but wanted to have her own business so she opened her store with her severance pay.  Now she has a successful store.  Her next goal is to improve the conditions in her home.  She is asking for a loan to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, bread, soft drinks, soaps, and other things so she can have the things that her customers most request.  She estimates that this loan will be of great help since she will be able to offer her products and increase her sales and income.  Her plans for the future are to grow her business and buy more products.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 32-year-old married woman with 3 children. She lives in Dolores,Clarin,Philippines.

Maribel sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month she earns 2,000 PHP. She requests a loan for 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Maribel has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Maribel hopes to improve her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a 57-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in Dolores,Clarin,Philippines.

Marita sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP. She requests a loan for 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Marita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.  In the future, Marita hope to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Arcily

texts.en:
Arcily is a 33-year-old married woman with no children. She lives in Pan-ay,Clarin,Philippines.

Arcily sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. She requests a loan for 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Arcily has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Arcily hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a 42-year- old widow with 6 children.   He lives in Colambutan,Settlement,Tudela. 

To earn a living, Fernando has a business selling native wine or ''tuba'' in the community. He earns about 7,000 PHP each month. Fernando requests a loan to restock his store with native wine or ''tuba''.

Fernando has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Fernando would like to start other profitable businesses.

loans.use: to restock his store with native wine or ''tuba''.

loans.name: Bertrand

texts.en: Bertrand is a 37-year-old Cameroonian. He is single and has one child who is four years old and attends primary school. He has been in this business for over three years which makes him very experienced and stable. He is likely to succeed because his business is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his profit by 25%, and his standard of living will improve as well.

loans.use: To buy cloth or tissue to sew and sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with 5 children. She is 55 years old and lives in Libertad Alto,Sinacaban,Philippines.

Victoria is a farmer and grows fruit to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She requests a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

Victoria has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Victoria hopes to start other profitable businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is 35 years old and lives in Lahore with her husband and three children. 

Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He has been using salon instruments for many years. His instruments have worn out and need to be replaced. He wants to buy new instruments but his financial condition does not allow him to buy new instruments. 

Due to her husband's low purchasing power, Sakina requested a loan so that her husband can become empowered and can easily buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, a front mirror, and a revolving chair.

Sakina hopes that this loan will work positively and she would be able to save some money for household expenses. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new instruments for the barber shop.

loans.name: Gilberth Osvaldo

texts.es: Gilberth de 21 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace mucho tiempo. Él es un joven trabajador quien se gana la vida por medio de la costura artesanal. Junto a su madre han logrado establecer un pequeño taller de costura el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Tienen mucho tiempo de haber establecido su pequeño negocio por lo que cuentan con mucha clientela que cada día los prefieren más. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en las materias primas (variedad de telas, hilos, agujas, etc.) para la elaboración de prendas de vestir y así poder cubrir una mayor demanda y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Gilberth is 21 years old and has lived in a home of his own with his family for some time.  He is a young worker who earns a living by doing artistic sewing.  He and his mother have managed to set up a sewing shop which is their main source of income.  They have had their small business for a long time and have many customers who prefer them.  He is asking for this loan through FUSAI to buy supplies (a variety of fabrics, thread, needles, etc.) to make clothing and be able to cover their customer demand and increase their sales and income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor lives in Dilijan city which is in the Tavush region. He is married and he has two beautiful daughters.  Both of them are already students. His elder daughter studies at the paid division of Yerevan State University and the faculty of Philology at the department of Russian Language and Literature. His second daughter studies at the same University and the same faculty but at the department of Romano and Germanic languages, but she also studies at the paid division. Grigor works at the computer office and there he repairs computers and printing machines.  His wife also works there as a manager. Despite that both of them are employed, nevertheless they both do not manage to earn their family living and also to pay for their daughters’ education.
Grigor asks a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for his daughters’ tuition fees for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay for his daughters’ tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Bao Beoneere Group

texts.fr:
Mr ZAKARYA est responsable du groupe BAO BEONEERE. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 05ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. Personne ne va  à l’école. Il a 03personnes en charge.
Mr est boutiquier  depuis 02ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes .
Il veut s’acheter 15 sacs de riz, 05 bidons d’huile de 20 litres et  10 cartons de spaguetti.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle et mieux s’occuper de sa  famille .
texts.en:
Zakarya is the head of the Bao Beoneere group. He is married and the father of two. The oldest is five years old and the youngest is one. Neither of them is in school. Zakarya has three people in his care.

Zakarya has been running a shop for two years. He buys his supplies at the local market. He has both male and female customers.

He would like to buy 15 sacks of rice, five 20-litre cans of oil and ten boxes of spaghetti.

Zakarya would like to reinvest his profits in his business. His ambition is to buy a plot of land and be able to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of rice, five 20-litre cans of oil and 10 boxes of spaghetti.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Blema Tesaa 2 Group

texts.en:
This group, "Blema Tesaa 2," comprises ten members, all entrepreneurs who are seeking better opportunities to move on in life. They live in the city of Accra, a beautiful place where trading is very popular and well established.

They are into the sales of scarves, sandals, provisions, sugar cane, traditional clothing (kente) and underwear. This is their first loan with Kiva and their third loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

One of the members, Regina, has been in the group for the past three years. She has established a good friendship with all of her neighbors and friends. She likes the fact that all the members of the group are united and much like a family.

Josephine is 56 years old and single living with her twenty-two year old daughter. She stays in the family house she lives in, and her child is school-going.

For 20 years, Regina, who is second from the left in the photo, has been selling 'Kente' clothing (traditional clothing) throughout the week at her shop. 

She plans to use the new loan to buy more clothing so that she can sell enough to take care of her child. Her goal is to stay healthy so she can keep working to take care of her child. 

The total loan amount of 7,200 Ghana cedi (GHS) is to improve businesses.

loans.use: to buy more clothing so that she can sell enough to take care of her child.

loans.name: José Melecio

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Él aprendió el oficio de las artesanías (elaboración de hamacas) desde que él se acompañó con su esposa, pues fue ella fue quien le enseño el arte con el hilo de seda y hoy en día también de poliseda. Gracias a su empeño, fue así como él desde ese tiempo hasta hoy en día hace hamacas, para luego comercializarlas en la ciudad o también trabaja por encargos. Las hace junto a su esposa y sus hijos de 4 a 5 hamacas por semana.
José, trabajaba en la agricultura (siembra de granos básicos maíz,  frijoles y maicillo), con el apoyo de sus hijos hace sus milpas y frijoleras, para tener para el consumo de la familia.
Compra los materiales para la elaboración de hamacas en la ciudad más cercana, el cual tiene que tomar dos buses de transporte urbano para llegar al destino, le lleva de tiempo media hora, él lo hace en compañía de su esposa, pues ya tienen el lugar donde siempre han comprado la materia prima, para posteriormente elaborar las hamacas.
Compra los materiales cada 8 o 15 días según vaya el negocio así compra los materiales. 
Solicita el crédito en credicampo, para la compra de madera, teja, laminas y varas para hacer unas mejoras en la vivienda que posee, ya que durante el invierno recién pasado tuvo problemas de que se le metía el agua en su vivienda y necesita hacer las reparaciones, a la vez cambiar la madera del techo.
También comprara 100 libras de hilo de seda valorados en $400.oo para seguir elaborando hamacas de seda y poliseda.
Con el crédito, tendrá una casa más segura, donde vivir con su familia y trabajar en las hamacas en un  ambiente mejor. Además, contara con material para ir elaborando hamacas y por ende tener mas ganancias económicas que le permitan darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
El sueño de José, en el futuro es hacer su propia casa de bloque para su familia y el crédito le será muy util pues las ganancias de las ventas de las hamacas, le ayudan para los trabajos de la agricultura los cuales se aproximan.
texts.en:
José, age 56, lives with his wife and children.  He learned the trade of hammock making from his wife.  She taught him the art of the silk thread and nowadays, also poly silk.  Thanks to his perseverance and effort he has been making hammocks since then to sell in the city or he also works by custom order.  He makes 4 to 5 hammocks per week with his wife and children.  
José worked in agriculture growing corn, beans, and sorghum.  With the help of his children he takes care of his corn and bean fields for his family's consumption.    
He buys the materials for making the hammocks at the closest city by taking 2 urban transit buses which takes him half an hour.  He goes with his wife since they already have a place where they always buy the raw materials to later make the hammocks.  He buys the materials every 8 to 15 days depending on how the business is going.  
He is requesting a loan from CrediCampo to buy wood, tiles, sheets, and rods to make improvements to his house because last winter he had problems with water getting into his home and he needs to make repairs and at the same time change the wood on the roof.  He will also buy 100 pounds of silk thread valued at $400 to keep making his hammocks of silk and poly silk. 
With this credit he will have a safer house where to live with his family and work on the hammocks in a better environment.  In addition, he will have the material to make the hammocks and hence have more income to allow him to give his family a better quality of life.  
Jose's dream is to make his own brick house in the future for his family.  This loan will be very helpful because the earnings from the sale of the hammocks will help him for the agriculture work that is approaching.

loans.use: to buy wood, tiles, sheets, and rods to make improvements to his house and 100 pounds of silk thread valued at $400.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is an entrepreneur who is married and has four children. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 23 years. Little by little with the passing of the years, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to her animals' good condition, she has managed to attract a large number of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are happy with her work. 

Salima is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Dúo Acuarius Group

texts.es: Dúo Acuarius LA SEÑORA Ledy de 45 años de edad,madre de 3 hijos y estan estudiando ella tiene un negocio de estetica de belleza la cual lleva varios años de tenerla y le ha ido muy bien, anterior mente tubo un credito en kiva la cual utilizo en la invercion de su negocio, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de belleza ya que se viene la epoca navideña y es cuando mas demanda tiene de sus clientes esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito que esta solicitando.
texts.en: Ledy is 45 years old and the mother of three children who attend school.  She has had a beauty salon business for several years and it has gone well for her.  She has previously had a Kiva loan which she used to invest into her business.  This time she is asking for a loan to buy beauty products because the Christmas season is approaching and this is when her customer demand increases and this loan will be of help to her.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Mrs Uranchimeg, 46 years old, lives with her husband and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been teaching children at kindergarten for 11 years. Her husband is currently unemployed. Her sister has the position of distribution manager at a private firm. She is requesting a loan of 4,900,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it emits less harmful pollutants into the air. Uranchimeg's husband will use the car for a taxi service in order to generate income.

loans.use: to buy an electric car so that her husband can use it for taxi service

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is 58 years old. Her husband has grown old and stays at home. She is the mother of five children and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She sews bags with her two daughters and two sons at home to feed her family. She has two sewing machines that her daughters operate to sew schoolbags and handbags. Her two sons deal with the customers, take orders from them and sew the bags on order.  She wants to sell her bags directly in the market so that they can get the maximum reward for their efforts. But she does not have the initial capital to buy raw materials to make the bags.

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy raw materials such as Rexine, zippers, buckles, etc for sewing purses and bags. Irshad thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make bags and purses.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit has become a very expected and responsible client both for Nor Horizon and Kiva. He lives in Ijevan with his wife, two daughters, and his parents. 

Davit has a rich and accurate credit history; in Nor Horizon he already has five loans and this will be his third loan from Kiva. Davit’s first Kiva loan was of great help for him, since at that time he was engaged in bee keeping, and he bought 10 or 12 beehives, wax papers, and frames for his bee families. 

The second Kiva loan he used for his new occupation; he installs and maintains gas cylinders in cars (with the help of the loan he bought several gas cylinders and new equipment to install cylinders in customer cars). He continues with this business.

Now Davit asks his third Kiva loan in an amount of 1,100,000 Armenian drams again to buy several gas cylinders and some needed materials for his work. This will be his third loan from Kiva, and he greatly needs it.

Davit says all the income from his work he spends for the needs of his young family.  He also managed to build a small garage for his car service activities, since he used to work in his yard.

loans.use: to buy several gas cylinders and some needed materials for his work

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 35 years old and he lives in Ijevan city which is in Tavush region. He is married and he has two sons. Sargis runs his own business; he sells fruits and vegetables in the wholesale market of Ijevan. He is sure that in the whole market, his stall is the most rich, colorful and tasty compared to the others. 

His business income has given him an opportunity to build a small shop and some part of the products they sell inside of it. Sargis sells apples, pears, grapes, bananas, kiwi, oranges, pomegranates, lemons, nuts, tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers and greens. All the products he buys from villagers, who have become perfect partners for him. 

This will be Sargis’ third loan from Kiva, and as he says, all the successes and income from his business that he has had for several years are thanks to his previous two Kiva loans and its support. 

He asks for a loan 600,000 Armenian drams in order to refresh his stall’s assortment (apples, pears, grapes, bananas, kiwi, oranges, pomegranates, lemons, nuts, tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers and greens).

loans.use: to refresh his stall’s assortment (apples, pears, grapes, bananas, kiwi, oranges, pomegranates, lemons, nuts, tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers and greens)

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan is 37 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He is married and he has two daughters and a new born son. Vahan’s wife works as a nurse. He works at the biggest company in Armenia producing candies and sweets. He distributes these products to nearly 700 shops in his region. As he mentions, the sweets that this company produces are really very popular and children like them very much. Vahan considers this business very profitable and good for his family. 

Now he asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some new assortments of candies and cakes since connected with coming Christmas and New Year's holidays he already has a lot of orders from shops.

loans.use: to buy some new assortments of candies and cakes

loans.name: Jambuli

texts.en: Jambuli is a 48-year-old married man who lives in Kalinino, Gardabani district. His family includes his parents, wife, two daughters and a son. Jambuli's father works at a petrol station and generates 400 GEL monthly. The borrower is also employed. He is an artisan and gets private orders. Jambuli's average income is 200 GEL per month. His salary, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of the family. Jambuli has a great desire to start a stable business that will take care of his family's everyday needs. He requested 3,000 GEL to open a general store at his house. He has already built the interior of this store and needs money to purchase a wide range of products. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. This money will also be a great help to his hard-working wife, who will be the sales clerk in the store and have her own activity. Jambuli relies on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To purchase a wide range of products

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is a 51-year-old single man, who lives alone in the village of Gomareti. Shalva cultivates his own plot of land and sows potatoes and pumpkins. Seasonally, he sells his harvested potatoes to the vegetable retailers and goes to the capital city open market to sell pumpkin seeds at wholesale.
 
In order to earn a stable monthly income, Shalva is requesting a loan. With the loan amount, he plans to start a fish selling business. Specifically, he will buy fish in Poti (a town on the eastern Black Sea coast) at wholesale prices and will sell them in his district with a price mark-up. Shalva will generate a good income and will be able to cover his daily expenses easily. He appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to start a fish selling business.

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Senaki. She has a husband and five-year-old son. Her husband doesn't have a stable job; sometimes during the month, he has a few orders for renovating and constructing houses. The income from this activity isn't enough for the thee-members family to cover food and everyday costs. 

According to this, Bela has decided to start her own business. Bela couldn't receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product between Kiva and Credo. 

She requested a loan of 300 USD to begin trading in clothing and bed-clothing. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase the products at wholesale prices, and then resell among her friends and neighbors. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Because of the Start Up program, Bela will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothing and bed-clothing.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 27 years old. He lives in the village of Khovle with his father and wife. Zurab works as a watchman at a capital city shopping center and goes from his village to work every day. He gets a small monthly salary. The family nevertheless lives in poverty because the existing income is not enough for their three-member family. 

Zurab has requested a loan to start a dairy farm. His loan request was approved as part of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The loan will be used for purchasing a milk cow. Zurab will place the cow in the cattle shed located in his yard and will start selling the milk at the local market. The family's income should increase by 150–200 GEL (Georgian Lari), which is a 40% to 50% increase. The family's living conditions will significantly improve and Zurab will be able to expand his farm in future.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow in order to start a dairy business.

loans.name: Merabi

texts.en: Merabi is a 47-year-old married man, who lives in Senaki. He lives with his wife, two children, and mother. His wife is unemployed and takes care of his children. His mother gets monthly assistance from the local government. Merabi is a taxi driver; he serves the local people and generates 300-350 GEL per month. Despite this compensation, it's hard to support 4 family members with this income. So, he decided to start a clothing trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Merabi received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Start up Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of 1,500 USD, he will purchase clothing and other home products at a wholesale price and sell them in Senaki's agricultural market area. He plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children. Merabi is a hard-working and motivated person and the Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to start a clothing trading business

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Bernardina is a married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari (variety store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area. This is the source of her income.

Bernardina is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, bread, biscuits, soda and beverages, soap, and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, bread, biscuits, soda and beverages, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Ghazal Group

texts.en: This group is called Ghazal and consists of four members who are all women. All of them are friends from Hodeida, Yemen. Lolah is a 32-year-old married woman with children. She started her business as a dressmaker. With years of experience to her credit, she now has a good command to sell different type of products. Recently, she is selling ladies' fabrics, incense, and perfumes.  She is taking a loan of 30,000 YER (Yemeni Rial) from AMB (Al-Amal Microfinance Bank) and intends to use her loan to better develop her business by purchasing incense and perfumes to increase her profits. Her profits will allow her to help meet her family’s needs. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for funding the first loan.

loans.use: to purchase incense and perfumes to increase her profits.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es un señor de 49 años de edad, soltero, tiene cuatro hijos; actualmente vive junto a tres de ellos en San Antonio Palopó, Sololá
El se dedica a la elaboración y venta de telas típicas que los turistas demandan. La elaboración de las telas lo realiza en la casa donde vive. La venta de este producto la lleva a cabo en su pueblo y también lo vende en el mercado de Panajachel. Esta actividad la realiza porque es algo que tiene mucha demanda y le genera los ingresos necesarios para aportar al sostenimiento de su familia. 
Tiene más de 10 años realizando esta labor; además de esta actividad el también se dedica a realizar oficios de jornalero (trabajo de campo), con lo cual complementa su presupuesto familiar
El solicita un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para compra de materiales para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda
Santiago tiene como unos de sus anhelos más importantes mejorar  completamente su casa para  proporcionarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago is a 49 year old single man who has 4 children.  He currently lives with 3 of them in San Antonio Palopó, Sololá.  
He works making and selling characteristic local fabrics that tourists demand.  He makes the fabrics in the house where he lives and sells them in his town and in the market of Panajachel.  He's dedicated to this trade because it is something that has a lot of demand and generates the necessary income to support his family.  He's been doing this work for 10 years and additionally works as a day laborer (fieldwork) to complement his family budget.  
He requests a loan of Q 4,000.00 to buy materials to make improvements to his home.  
Santiago's most important wish is to completely improve his house to give his family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve his home.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is from Saguing, Maria, Siquijor. She is 38 years old and married. This year, Jessica applied for membership in PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner. 

Recently, Jessica asked for financial assistance of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional  curtains, dresses, shoes and sandals. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To buy additional curtains, dresses, shoes and sandals to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is single without children. She is 30 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines. Analyn  is a farmer and grows fruit crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizers. Analyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Analyn hopes to save and start another business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer

loans.name: Marifi

texts.en: Marifi is happily married with three children. She lives in Pasihagon, Siquijor. She has a fishing stand in the market and she generates income from it. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for a year. Because she is a member, PMPC extends help to Marifi with the additional capital for her fishing business. With the loan, the fishing stand she has will be productive and can give her additional income for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment such as fish net

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita has owned and operated a general store, selling a variety of grocery goods for more than five years. She earns well for the family and was able to repay her previous loan from GDMPC successfully. She used her previous loan to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to resell. In the future, Angelita wants to build a house and to ensure that her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is married with four children. She helps her husband to run a fishing business for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years and earns well for the family. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new fishing nets. She wants to improve their business and be able to provide a better living for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Damilde

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a  Danilde;  con su credikiva ella compró ropa y calzado sobre pedidos y así pudo responder pronto a su clientela. Hoy tiene más liquidez, un buen surtido y sus ventas y utilidades han aumentado, sus ingresos han mejorado fortaleciendo su negocio. Ella dice textualmente a sus financiadores: “Muchas agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, estoy aprovechando esta oportunidad al máximo para que sigan apoyándome.” En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará juguetería, artículos navideños, como ropa, calzado y detalles para el hogar y mercancía escolar. Con ello permanecerá surtida para este fin de año y también impactará a su clientela con artículos de estudios para estudiantes que muy pronto ingresaran a clases, haciendo de su credikiva una óptima inversión. .
texts.en: Thanks for helping Danilde.  She used her Kiva loan to buy clothing and shoes to order and she was able to respond to her customers.  Now she has more liquidity, a good assortment in her sales and her utility has increased.  Her income has increased and her business is stronger.  She says, “Many thanks to Kiva and Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  I am taking advantage of this opportunity to the maximum so that I can continue to get support.”  She is using her new Kiva loan to buy toys, Christmas items such as clothing, shoes, household goods, and school supplies.  With this she will remain stocked for the end of the year and also provide school supplies for her customers who will soon return to classes, making her Kiva loan a good investment.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Juana, quien con su credikiva logró invertir en pescado, camarones y productos del mar. Su capital de trabajo ha aumentado paulatinamente y con ello tiene una mayor liquidez. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a  sus financiadores: “Muchas gracias por el apoyo de Kiva y de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, espero seguir contando con su apoyo para continuar progresando. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará pescado, camarones y también mercancías variadas sobre pedidos, como ropa, calzado y accesorios femeninos. Su éxito está potencializado porque responderá a sus mejores clientes y con ello garantizará el pronto retorno de su inversión.
texts.en: Thanks you for helping Juana who used her Kiva loan to buy fish, shrimp, and seafood.  Her working capital has increased gradually and she has more liquidity.  She is sending the following message to the lenders, “Thank you very much for the support from Kiva and Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  I hope to continue with your support to continue making progress.”  She is using her Kiva loan to buy fish, shrimp, and merchandise to order such as clothing, shoes, and ladies’ accessories.  Her potential for success is increasing because she will respond to her best customers and quickly regain her investment.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Gemary

texts.en: Gemary is married with only one child. She runs a general store to add to her husband's income from farming. She has been doing this for five years earning more for the basic needs of the family. She borrowed a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell. She is hoping to improve her business and to provide a better life for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace helps her husband to earn a living with her general store and she has been doing this for three years. She sells grocery goods in their community and she earns an income for the family's needs. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. 

She always finds ways to improve their lives.  With her determination in doing her business, Grace hopes to gain more profit to improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace helps her husband in their fishing business in order to make a living. She has been doing this for five years and earning well for the family. Aside from this, she sells snacks in their community to earn additional income. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new fishing nets to use for fishing. She is hoping for a stable income so her family has a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Sandra Marlene

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
Aquí vive la señora Sandra, tiene 37 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  una hija de 8 años que estudian en escuela. Es Lic. En  Ciencias de la Educación.  
Doña Sandra es una gran madre que hace todo lo posible para darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija y todo esto a base de su esfuerzo, ella es Lic. En  Ciencias de la Educación  y trabaja como maestra en una escuela privada de la localidad, pero además también se dedica a la venta de productos Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella realiza sus ventas en los momentos que está desocupada de sus labores de maestra y también les vende a sus compañeras y madres de familia, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Esta desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan en el grupo. Sus sueños son tener un gran bazar y un nombramiento del Estado en una escuela o colegio.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo meets in the canton of 24 de Mayo in the province of Manabí.  The area is known for its beautiful scenery and its hard working people dedicated to agriculture and animal farming and it is where Mrs. Sandra lives.  
She is 37 years of age and a single mother with an 8 year old daughter who is in school.  Mrs. Sandra is a great mother who does everything possible to give the best to her daughter and does this based on her effort.  She is licensed in education sciences and teaches in a local private school.  She also sells Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and female accessories).  She sells her products when she's not busy with her duties as a teacher.  She also sells to her colleagues and mothers selling her products on credit and collecting every 8 days.  She's been doing this for 4 years and business has been very good.  
This loan is to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and jewelry.
She has been with the Grupo de Crédito from the beginning and she likes it because of the help given in the group.  Her dream is to have a great bazaar and obtain an appointment from the State in a school.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and jewelry.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica previously applied for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which she used to purchase raw ingredients such as sugar, bananas, and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan, again to pay for raw ingredients such as sugar, bananas, and other products needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her meet her daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rica hopes to have more customers and dreams of a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her life and business and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15-30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients such as sugar, bananas, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, tres de ellos mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 15 años que estudian en colegio y son los que aun viven en su casa. Su esposo no tiene trabajo fijo.
Doña María para ganar sus propios  recursos y con esto ayudarle a  su marido con los gastos del hogar desde hace tres años atrás decidió arreglar un local en su casa en la cual surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres, la misma que con el paso de los días ha ido mejorando y surtiendo cada día más y esto con la ayuda de los créditos.  Ella también con parte del crédito se dedica a la cría de pollos para lo cual tiene un corral, cuando tienen los pollos  el peso adecuado los vende en pie o por libras en su tienda.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda y alimento para pollos. Lleva 4 ciclos en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos para mejorar su negocio y su vida. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en: In the province of Manabí we find the region 24 De Mayo, where we meet the Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo (Group of New Horizon Loans of 24 de Mayo). It's known for its beautiful landscapes and for the hard-working people who grow agriculture and raise animals. In this place lives María, who is 40 years old, married and with 5 children. Three of them are adults, while the other two are 17 and 15, studying in high school and live at home. Her husband doesn't have a steady job. Doña María to make her own means and, with this, help her spouse with the household expenses, three years ago decided to set aside a place in her house to work as a small grocery store. With the passing of each day it has been getting better and producing more with the help of loans. Also, with part of the loan, she raises chickens, for which she has a coop. When the chickens are at a proper weight she sells them outright or per pound in her store. This loan is to buy groceries to sell in her store, and feed for her chickens. She has 4 cycles in the loan group and she likes it for the help she receives  with the loans to better her business and her life. She hopes to continue getting better and improving her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and feed for chickens.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah helps her husband to make a living. While her husband is a fisherman, Leah sells fruit in town, and also provides manicure and pedicure services, earning well for the family. 

Leah joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to buy additional tools for providing manicure and pedicure services. She hopes to gain more revenue from all of her business activities, and plans to save a portion of her income to repair their own house for a better living.

loans.use: to buy additional tools for providing manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn helps her husband in their fishing business to make a living. She also sells fish at the market. For the last five years in their business, Marilyn has been earning well, and has been able to provide for the needs of her three children. 

She has borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to purchase new fishing nets to be used in the business. Marilyn plans to improve her business by acquiring a new fishing boat from her profits.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets.

loans.name: Melencio

texts.en:
Melencio is married with three children. He operates his own farm to make a living, and has been doing this for many years, and is able to provide for his family's needs. 

Melencio wants to improve his farm to have a greener and more abundant harvest. Without hesitation, Melencio borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to purchase organic fertilizer to improve his farm. He hopes to have a stable income from the farm to provide a better living for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to improve his farm.

loans.name: Diogracia

texts.en:
Diogracia is thankful for the financial assistance that has been extended to her. She was able to buy more of the materials needed in her tailoring business. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her children as her income from the business helps with the family's everyday household expenditures. She works hard to provide for her family's everyday needs. 

Diogracia would like to apply for another loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials such as fabric and thread for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Diogracia dreams that her business will continue and hopes to have a better standard of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials such as fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is a resident from the town of Panglao, Bohol. Zenaida is engaged in hog raising business. She is asking for a loan to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her pig-raising business, thus augmenting her profit and income. Zenaida hopes to make her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, aged 57, is a responsible mother and lives happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a scrap shop and deals in scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells them to recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have the funds to buy scrap goods and thus does not have scrap to sell to earn income. Therefore, Naseem requested a loan for her son, so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and compile some savings for sudden needs or incidents. 

Naseem is very impressed with the honorable support and wishes to take out more loans after repaying this one. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods for resale to recycling factories.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is from Sindangan in the Philippines. She is 42 years old and has two school-aged children. She earns a living retailing sacks of different sizes. She has been in this business for three years and earns approximately Php 7,000 per month. 

Nenita has signed her membership to PMPC for her funding needs. She has applied for the loan in order to restock sacks to sell. This is Nenita's first loan  from PMPC. She hopes to sustain her business and she wants to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to restock sacks for retail

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 34-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years. His generated income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw’s body, but does not have the sufficient amount to buy new body.

Therefore, Saira has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy the auto rickshaw body. She hopes that she would be able to make enough savings to meet the sudden expenses in future. She thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy rickshaw body.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a resident of the town of Panglao, Bohol. She has earned a living through her hog raising business for almost ten years now. She is also engaged in a food vending business. 

Paz needs a loan to buy additional ingredients for food vending like meat, spices and seasonings, as well as feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business as well as her food vending business thus augmenting her yield and profit. 

In the future, Paz hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food vending like meat, spices and seasonings and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the materials needed in her tailoring business which is running for twenty eight years now. Her income from the business is assisting her family's everyday needs. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Norma dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Aleksan

texts.en: Aleksan is an experienced farmer from the Shenik village, in the Armavir region. He lives with his wife, and two young sons that are 4 and 3 years old. Aleksan works in the private sector and his wife works at the village kindergarten. Both of them work hard to be able to meet the increasing needs of their family. Their salaries alone, however, are not enough to fully meet the family’s needs. Aleksan is also engaged in cattle breeding and in the cultivation of alfalfa. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of their income. Aleksan currently is eager to expand his agribusiness to be able to cover the increasing costs of the family. To reach his goal Aleksan needs a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase 8 sheep. Aleksan and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase 8 sheep.

loans.name: Eva De Jesus

texts.es: Eva  es una mujer  de 30 años  luchadora , trabajadora  que habita  en la comunidad  flor de pino  hasta la edad de 14 años vivió con sus padres, después conoció al que hoy es su esposo y se casó con el ha formado un bonito hogar  con tres hijos  estos estudian en la escuela mas cercana a la comunidad  , comenta que su esposo y ella hacen todo lo posible  por darles los mejor a sus hijos pues quieren que aprovechen el tiempo estudien y  se preparen  sean personas de bien . Su esposo y ella se dedican al cultivo y siembra de granos básicos esto les permite subsistir y darles lo necesario a sus hijos como es la alimentación, educación y  vestimenta. Además en las temporadas de cosecha de café  reciben otros ingresos ya que tienen una pequeña parcela  de café  lo que cosechan lo vendan a comerciantes  que llegan a la comunidad. En la comunidad que habitan no tienen energía eléctrica, y ahora que sus hijos van más grandes ven la necesidad de tener energía en su hogar para que ellos puedan estudiar, jugar y compartir en familia. Es por tal razón que están solicitando crédito para  comprar un sistema solar e instalarlo en su hogar esto será de mucho beneficio para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Eva, 30, is a hard-working, determined woman who lives in the community of Flor de Pino.  She lived with her parents until the age of 14 when she married and formed her own lovely family with three children who study at the closest community school.  She says she and her husband do all they can to give their children the best of everything.  They want them to study and become good citizens.  

Her husband is a farmer and grows basic grains to earn an income to provide the children with food, education and clothing.  During the coffee harvest season they also receive income selling coffee from a small coffee cropland they have.  They sell to merchants who visit the community.  

The area where they live does not have electric energy and now that the children are older electricity is necessary at home for them to study, play and share time with family.  Therefore, Eva is requesting a loan to buy a solar panel system to install at home to help the family.

loans.use: To buy solar panels for her house.

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: Octavio  tiene 68 años de edad vive en una  comunidad de nombre  santa  Ana  él fue el tercer hijo del matrimonio de sus padres, desde muy temprana edad le toco enfrentarse a la vida y luchar para así poder alimentarse y ayudar su familia,  de lo cual se siente muy orgulloso pues todo lo que hoy tiene lo ha logrado gracias al esfuerzo  y el trabajo  realizado día con día. Tiene sus  propias tierras  las que  cultiva, además de tener una pequeña finca de café la que le da muy buenos ingresos cada año ya que saca buena cosecha  con esto le permite  tener una vida digna y honrada para él , su  esposa , hijos y nietos. Dice que en esta comunidad  a pesar de muchos intentos por llevar la energía convencional no ha sido posible, ya que están bastante alejados  por las noches y madrugada  que se levantan tienen que hacer uso de los phocos , candil para poder iluminarse pues no hay otra manera, ahora que está la posibilidad de tener energía a través de un sistema solar  solicita se le apoye en darle el crédito para comprar un sistema solar haciendo uso del sol para así generar luz .
texts.en:
Octavio, 68, lives in a community called Santa Ana.  He was the third child in his family and from a very young age learned to meet life's challenges head on and work hard to feed and support his own family.  He is very proud because eveything he has today has been thanks to his daily efforts and hard work.  He has his own cropland and a small coffee plantation which gives him a good income every year, allowing him to have a dignified life along with his wife, children and grandchildren.

He says that despite many efforts to bring conventional electricity to the community, it has not been possible because of the distance.  At night and during the early morning hours they have to use lanterns since there is no other light source.  Now that it is possible to have solar powered energy, Octavio is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system to generate electricity.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for his house.

loans.name: Judi Grimaneza

texts.es:
Judi Grimaneza tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad ubicada cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración de replicas de artesanía y adornos para el hogar, son una familia unida, su esposo brinda servicio de de labores agrícolas, Judi Grimaneza ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevo soles para la compra de instrumentos que le apoyen en la elaboración de replicas artesanas y de esta manera brindar un mejor acabado para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Judi Grimaneza, 49, lives with her husband in the district of Zaña, a community located near the valley of the Jequetepeque River.  The local people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is in the Chiclayo Province which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru

She makes replicas of artisan crafts and ornaments at home.  Her family is a very close-knit one and her husband works offering farming services.  Judi Grimaneza has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 PEN to buy tools for her craft replica work.  This will allow her to offer her customers better finished products and increase the income for the family.

loans.use: To buy tools to make artisan replicas.

loans.name: William Evenor

texts.es: William  tiene 30 años de edad  actualmente está viviendo en la comunidad flor de pino con su esposa  y una hija  Dice que el solo estudio hasta tercer grado de primaria  ya que en la comunidad donde vivía con sus padres cuando era un niño  no había escuela cerca además  estaba el tiempo de la guerra   y  la zona era  un poco peligrosa. Su padre le enseño a trabajar la tierra a sembrar granos básicos dice que su padre le heredo 6 manzanas de tierra las que cultiva  y de ahí obtiene ingresos para mantener a su familia su esposa también lo apoya ya que tienen una pequeña pulpería  esto es otro ingreso . Manifiesta que en la comunidad no tienen energía eléctrica  en su hogar usan  candelas , pero considera que es necesario y muy útil tener energía ya que podrían  cerrar la pulpería más tarde , su hija estudiar sin duda el tener luz en la vivienda traería mucho beneficio para la comunidad y su familia es por eso que está solicitando crédito para comprar un sistema solar.
texts.en:
William, 30, lives in the community of Flor de Pino with his wife and daughter.  He has only a third grade education because there was no nearby school where he lived with his parents when he was a little boy,  It was also during war time and the area was a bit dangerous.  His father taught him how to farm the land and grow basic grains.  And from his father he received land to cultivate so he could earn an income to support his family.  His wife also runs a small grocery store for extra income.

William says the community does not have electricity so they use candles at home.  But he feels having electricity would be advantageous because they could close the grocery store later and his daughter could study.  Without a doubt having electricity at home would benefit the community and his family, so he is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for his house.

loans.name: Mirian Soledad

texts.es:
Miriam Soledad tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella es una mujer emprendedora tiene una bodega que ofrece productos de primera necesidad, tambien se dedica a brindar servicio de fotocopiado, teniendo como cliente principal al Municipio de su distrito y ofrece pensión a los trabajadores de la Policía que trabajan en esa zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes para abastecer su bodega y de esta manera ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam Soledad is 53 years old. She lives with her children in the district of Nueva Arica. Its residents work in agriculture, trade and ranching. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region in northern Peru.

She is an enterprising woman. She has a convenience store where she sells staple products. She also offers photocopying and has the district town hall as a main customer. She also offers meals to the workers from the police department who work in that area. 

She has asked for a loan of 3,500 nuevos soles to buy groceries to stock her store and offer a wider variety of products to her customers, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her business.

loans.name: Nikleby Weider

texts.es:
Nikleby tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de arroz, maíz, yucas, entre otros, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de albañilería desde hace 8 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos cemento, ladrillo y una segunda para darle mantenimiento a sus equipos y herramientas y así mejorar su servicio, generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nikleby is 30 years old. He lives in the district of Oyotún, a community that is dedicated to agriculture, especially growing corn, rice, yucca, and more. It is also dedicated to trade and ranching. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. 

He has offered bricklaying services for 8 years. His business is located at his residence. He has asked for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy materials such as cement and bricks. Another part of it will be used to do maintenance on his equipment and tools and thus improve his service, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement and bricks.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie helps her husband in the fishing business for a living. She has sold fish in the market for ten years, and she earns well for the family. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy new fishing nets. 

In the near future, Merlie plans to use her profit to repair their house for better, more comfortable living conditions for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a 64-year-old woman from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is married with four grown children. Her husband worked as a carpenter to support their family. She sells Avon products such as lotions, body sprays, deodorants and other beauty products. Aside from selling Avon products, Carmen raises and sells pigs to earn additional income. Both her businesses started quite a few years ago. 

Carmen is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and more Avon supplies. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase her business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and more Avon supplies

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a 56-year-old married woman from the municipality of Getafe, Bohol. She has been in the business of farming rice for more than 10 years now. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings, and to pay for labor. 

Teodora is dedicated to making her business work since this is her main source of livelihood. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business to be able to provide healthy meals and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a businesswoman who sells various articles of clothing. She also ventures into different merchandise like shoes, bags and other saleable items. Merlyn earns approximately PHP 20,000 per month that supports the education of her two children and their family needs. 

Merlyn has been a PMPC member since 2011 and has taken out previous loans. She is confident of her credit history as she has repaid her loans in a timely manner. Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 50,000. She wants to restock dry good items. She deeply wishes to improve their living conditions and to be able to erect a showroom for her clothing sales.

loans.use: to restock dry good items

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is a married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has two children aged 12 and 17. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store business. Aside from her sari-sari store, Hilaria sells barbecued chicken and meat. 

Currently, Hilaria is in need of a loan for her business. She is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise like noodles, canned goods, shampoo, and chicken and meat for barbecuing. Through this, she will be able to improve her business thus augmenting her profit and income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like noodles, canned goods, shampoo, and chicken and meat for barbecuing

loans.name: Farah's Group

texts.en:
Farah is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband provides whitewashing and oil painting services to his customers in the community: sometimes, he also has to go out of the city. Her husband has a new contract for whitewashing and oil painting of newly constructed houses but he does not have the paint brushes or rollers needed to provide these services.

Farah has requested a loan so her husband can buy new paintbrushes, rollers, kerosene, paint, oil, etc. Her husband has few savings: this is why he is unable to buy new tools to provide whitewashing services. She wants to change her family's conditions and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband. Farah is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools, paint and oil for whitewashing services.

loans.name: Yobana Marisol

texts.es:
Yobana Marisol tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y venta de mazamorras desde hace más de 6 años, cuenta con clientela considerable por el buen sabor de sus preparos, Yobana ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de utensilios descartables platos, tenedores, entre otros y una segunda parte para la darle mantenimiento a su carrito sandwichero y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yobana Marisol is 35 years old. She lives with her son in the district of Oyotún, a community dedicated to farming, trade, and ranching. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo, located in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

She has sold salchipapas and mazamorras for more than 6 years. She has a considerable amount of customers because of the good flavor of her food. Yobana has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy disposable utensils, such as plates, forks and more. Another part of the loan is to do maintenance on her sandwich cart so she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy disposable utensils such as plates, forks and more.

loans.name: Mary Bell

texts.es:
Recientemente Maribell de Bogotá,  para completar los estudios de Titulación en Educación Preescolar, ha decidido complementar   el perfil profesional  en la institución,  en la carrera de enfermería y así ofrecer los servicios no solo en educación, sino en un excelente cuidado y protección de salud con cada uno de los niños que tenga a  cuidado.

Dispone  de experiencia para las actividades que desempeñan, pues durante  años de formación ha tenido que realizar en  diferentes empresas del ámbito de la actividad profesional diversos cursos de formación que se indicaran en el curriculum y que han conllevado a la decisión de el estudio de la carrera de enfermería.

Maribell es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser una persona trabajadora y tener una metas propuestas para el futuro, siempre pensando en el bienestar y calidad de vida que les puede brindar a las hijas, las cuales ha sacado adelante sola, por ello es que Maribell ha escogido realizar la carrera de enfermería y adquirir mayor conocimiento para completar el perfil profesional. 
La institución además de brindarle una excelente formación y preparación en los diferentes ambientes que vaya a desarrollar, también le están dando la facilidad con el convenio con kiva para comenzar los estudios  ya que sin el convenio los ingresos adquiridos no alcanzarían para estudiar esta profesión.
texts.en:
In order to complete her studies in pre-school education, Maribell from Bogotá has recently decided to add to her educational profile and study nursing. That way, she can offer services not just in education but in offering excellent health-care and protection to each of the children she looks after.

Maribell has experience in this work. During her years of training she has had to do various professional development courses at different companies. Part of her curriculum, these courses helped Maribell to decide that she wanted to study nursing.

Maribell is a hard worker, and she has goals for the future. She is always thinking about the well-being of her daughters and the quality of life she can offer them. Alone she has helped them to prosper and it is for them that Maribell has decided to study nursing. With it, she an develop her knowledge and have a new skill for her CV

As well as offering excellent training in the different areas of work, CampoAlto is also making life easier for Maribell to start her studies with this Kiva agreement. Without it, Maribell would not have enough money to study nursing.

loans.use: to pay for one semester's matriculation fees.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío del Yambolon, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella cuanta con una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, que funciona más de 03 años, por su experiencia y su buen servicio cuenta con bastante clientela, también se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a los cultivos de café y maíz, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 33 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Yambolon village, a rural area in the Pomahuaca district. Two hours from the city of Jaén, the area is part of the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands. Here the people work in farming, running businesses and raising livestock.

Miguel has had a grocery store in his home for three years. Given his experience and the good service he offers, Miguel has quite a lot of customers. He also works in farming, growing coffee and corn. Miguel has applied for a loan of 2000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy merchandise to stock up his business and, thus, earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock up his business.

loans.name: Presiñano

texts.es:
Presiñano tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la venta de animales menores patos, cuyes, pavos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, también ofrece servicio de labores agrícolas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevo soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Presiñano is 55 years old and lives with his wife in the Cayaltí district, in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. Here the people work in farming, running businesses and raising livestock.

Along side his wife, Presiñano makes a living selling young animals, such as ducks, turkeys and guinea pigs in the area behind their house. Presiñano also does farming work. He has applied for a loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles in order to buy animal feed. With this he can earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten up animals.

loans.name: Yafet

texts.es: Yafet es un joven de 28 años de la comunidad el sardinal, no  pudo terminar su estudiar de primaria por vivir muy aislado y a la vez tenía que ayudar a su papa aprendiendo labores del campo.  Actualmente él tiene su propio terreno con mucho esfuerzo lo ha logro donde siembra café y granos básicos, vive con su esposa y su hijo,  a él le acostado mucho el hacerse de sus propias cosas,  como en la comunidad donde vive no hay electricidad es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un panel solar y  poderle ofrecer una mejor condición de vida a su familia, porque ellos utilizan candiles y es perjudicial para la salud
texts.en: Yafet is 28 years old and lives in the Sardinal community. He was not able to finish primary school as he lives in a very isolated area, and he also had to help his father and learn how to work in the fields. Yafet now has his own land and, with a lot of effort, he has managed to sow coffee and basic grains. He lives with his wife and son. It has been difficult for Yafet to have his own things. There is now electricity where Yafet lives and so he is applying for a loan to buy a solar panel in order to offer his family better living conditions. The family uses oil lamps but these carry health risks.

loans.use: to buy a small solar power system.

loans.name: Nestora

texts.en: Nestora is a married woman from Panglao on the island of Bohol, the Philippines. She has a pig raising business and in addition she sells fish, while her husband works as a fisherman. She has been in both businesses for several years now. She has requested a loan of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional piglets, feed and fish nets. With these, she will be able to improve her businesses and thus augment her income and yield.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and fish nets

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men is a widowed mother of three children, living in a remote area of Kampong Thom province. She is 51 years old and an experienced farmer who has been growing rice for more than 25 years. She owns about one and half hectare of farmland and earns approximately KHR 30,000 per day.

In order to help her develop her farming business, she has requested a loan to purchase a plot of land to enlarge her farming area. 

In this way, she hopes to increase her yields and thus improve income for her family. 

In the future, she aims to continue working with her farming business and improve her general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to enlarge her farming area.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es: María de 44 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo quien ya es mayor de edad y colabora con la economía del hogar. María tiene trece años de dedicarse al comercio de ropa, lociones, cremas y antojitos típicos. Una parte de la vena la realiza de manera ambulante y el resto en su hogar de residencia. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de  mercadería. Con el Monto solicitado comprará: ropa, lociones, cremas y carnes para la realización de los antojitos típicos que tanto le demandan sus clientes. Espera poder tener este financiamiento y así poder incrementar su inventario con el fin de incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos que le permitan tener mejores condiciones de vida a ella y a su familia.
texts.en: María is 44 and lives in a house of her own with her husband and her son. The latter is already an adult and helps with household expenses. María has been a retailer for 13 years: she sells clothes, creams, lotions, and a local specialty called 'antojitos'. She sells some of her products door-to-door and some at her house. She asks for a loan in order to buy merchandise and ingredients for her shop. She will buy clothes, creams, and lotions, as well as meat, chicken, sweetcorn, and vegetables to make 'antojitos', which are very sought after by her customers. She hopes to get this loan, which would enable her to have more products in stock, which, in turn, would help her increase her sales and her income, so as to improver her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and ingredients.

loans.name: Dúo El Carmen Group

texts.es: Dúo El Carmen, la señora Maria Josefa de 31 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles desde hace 13 años, ella empeso a vender unos productos pero dia con dia ha luchado para salir adelante, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles, ya que en esta epoca aumenta la venta y entonces quiere aprovechar para invertir y crecer un poco mas en su negocio, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito.
texts.en: María Josefa, 31 years old, is one of the two integrants of the group 'Dúo El Carmen'. She has been selling groceries for the last 13 years, a business which has proved challenging from the start. She asks for a loan in order to buy more items to sell, since this is a very good season for business, a fact of which she wants to take advantage in order to make her business grow. She hopes for Kiva lenders' help with this loan.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daniel Alexander

texts.es: Daniel de 20 años de edad habita en casa de su abuela junto a su grupo familiar. Daniel es un joven muy comprometido, trabajador y responsable. Él se dedica  a la venda de ropa para dama, caballero y niño desde hace tres años. Gracias a su carisma y variedad de productos que ofrece tiene muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir para dama, caballeros y niños. Espera poder lograr su objetivo y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Daniel is 20 years old and lives at his grandmother's, together with the rest of the family. He is a very committed, hard-working and responsible youth. He has been selling clothes for women, men, and children for three years. Thanks to his charisma and the variety of products he has on offer, he has many loyal customers. He decided to ask for this loan in order to buy more clothes to sell. He hopes to reach his goal and improve his and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 30-year-old married woman living with her spouse and four children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a butcher by profession and he sells chicken from his shop. His daily practice is to buy broilers from the market and sell the meat at his shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income paying utility bills and this greatly reduced his ability to buy new stock. 
Thus, Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy more chickens. She dreams of being able to provide for all her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Deodita

texts.en:
