Deodita is 49 years old and has three school-aged children. She earns a meager income of Php 4,000 per month. This is how she supports the income of her husband. 

Deodita has enjoyed her membership with PMPC since 2007, and is receiving various benefits such as insurance. She took several loans and all were paid in a timely fashion. 

Now, she applied a loan to buy addiitional inventory to sell. 

She hope to sustain her business so she can continue providing for the education needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory

loans.name: Dúo Shalom Group

texts.es:
DUO SHALOM
La señora iris quien es integrante del dúo Shalom ha trabajado durante  varios años es madre de 4 hijos y tiene una venta de zapatos y sandalias la cual pudo aperturar con los créditos que la fundación le ha otorgado actualmente se dedica a tiempo completo a su negocio ya que tiene muchos sueños y metas no solo para ella si no que también para su familia ya que desea poder aperturar  otro local y tener una venta solo de Zapatos y una venta solo de sandalias, aunque ella bien sabe que se requiere de mucho esfuerzo pero espera en Dios poder lograrlo y ella nuevamente toca las puertas de fape para que se le otorgue un nuevo crédito para la inversión de zapato debido a la temporada que se acerca  esperando en DIOS que ustedes nuevamente le puedan ayudar.
texts.en:
Iris is one of the members of the "Dúo Shalom" group and she has worked for a number of years. She is the mother of four children. She sells shoes and sandals which she was able to start with loans from this foundation. She is working full-time now with her business as she has many goals and dreams. Not only for herself but also for her family. She wants to open another sales location and in one sell only shoes, in the other only sandals. She knows this would require a lot of effort but she trusts that God will help her achieve this.

She is once again knocking at Fape's door to request a new loan to invest in shoes for the coming season. She trusts in God that you will once again help her.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell.

loans.name: Jesson

texts.en: Jesson is studying to earn a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. He used his previous loan from GDMPC to pay his tuition fees for the first semester. He never allows any hindrances or difficulties to interrupt his ambition to get closer to his dream. Recently, Jesson borrowed a new loan to cover the costs of his school allowances for the current semester.  He wants to got a job related to his degree someday to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of his school allowances for the current semester.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana, who is married and has two children, manages her own store selling grocery items for a living. She has been doing this for three years, and she earns an income that supports her husband's income. She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to resell to boost her store's business. She wants to improve her business to further stabilize the family income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 32-year-old woman from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is married with one child, age 8. Her husband worked as a company guard to support their family.

Lolita is in the food vending business. She sells snack foods like peanut brittle, banana chips and other merienda (a light meal usually taken in the afternoon or for brunch, it fills in the meal gap between lunch at noon and dinner, or between breakfast and lunch). Her business was started six years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy three sacks of flour, two sacks of bananas, and four containers of oil. This will help Lolita continue her livelihood activity.

In the future, Lolita hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of flour, two sacks of bananas, and four containers of oil

loans.name: Evan Nicolas

texts.en: Evan Nicolas is married with an only child. He manages his own rice farm to make a living. In his two years of farming, he has earned well enough to provide for his family. Recently, Evan Nicolas borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy fertilizer in order to improve the farm. He hopes to be able to buy another farm to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella sells cosmetic products in her community to make a living. She collects her sales in cash or on an amortization basis where she can cater to her costumers. She has been doing this for more than two years and she earns well and she supports her husband's income from employment.

Recently she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional cosmetic products to resell for she had more orders from her costumers. Ella wants to have a better living for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetic products

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is running a little retail store in their community selling selected grocery items to make a living. She just started her business six months ago and she plans to expand her offerings.

Recently she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to pay for a coffee vending machine where she could sell coffee anytime. She wants to use her profit to improve her house and her business as well.

loans.use: to pay for coffee vending machine

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en:
Cheang, 42 years of age, is an experienced farmer who has been involved in a rice farming business for over 15 years. She is glad because, through farming activities, she has been able to sustain her family's basic necessities and send her children to school. With great support from her husband, Cheang is able to earn approximately 10,000 KHR per day. 
 
For continuous crop production growth, Cheang is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to add to her own capital to buy a parcel of land for growing rice. She hopes that lenders will not reject her loan so she can continue working with her farming business and give her family a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a parcel of land for growing rice

loans.name: Aquilia

texts.en:
Aquilia is a married woman and a mother of  four children from Baclayon, Bohol.  She earns a living by raising pigs, and has been in this line of work for four years.  

Aquilia is asking for a loan  to buy animal feed for the pigs. In the future, Aquilia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Maravillas” está conformada por 08 socios dispuestos a seguir trabajando bien. Gregoria es viuda y tiene 05 hijos, 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. A sus 49 años Gregoria ha logrado mejorar su situación económica. Su último crédito lo destinó para la compra de verduras y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es de tener su propio local donde pueda ofrecer sus verduras. El grupo “Las Maravillas” agradece  a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito ya que hace posible su progreso. Gregoria se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color negro.
texts.en:
The “Las Maravillas” communal bank is made up of eight members who are ready to continue working well. Gregoria is a widow, with five children, two of whom are still dependent on her. She sells vegetables door to door. At 49 years old she has been able to improve her economic situation. Her last loan was used to buy vegetables to offer to her customers. Her main desire is to have her own sales location to sell her vegetables.

The “Las Maravillas” communal bank members are grateful to the people who make this loan possible and allow them to progress. Gregoria is sitting in the photo, the first person on the left side, wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Kunheng

texts.en:
Kunheng is 64-years-old and a hardworking person. He has operated a farming business for over 30 years in the Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. He has three grown-up children, two of whom are married, while the remaining child is single and lives with him under the same roof.  Kunheng is a widower who always tries his best with his work in order to achieve his goals.

As of now, Kunheng is asking for a loan in the amount of USD 550 to buy a motorcycle to meet his daily transportation needs. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to get anywhere safely without needing to pay for a private taxi service.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to meet his daily transportation needs.

loans.name: Gomersenda

texts.en:
For 20 years now, Gomersenda has been engaged in a fishing and fish selling business together with her husband. She is 45 years old, and a mother of five children from Bohol, Philippines. Her husband works as a fisherman and she helps by selling his catch.

Gomersenda is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy a fish net to ensure the productive fishing of her husband. She believes that if she is provided with financial support through the loan, they will be able to enhance their catch and their sales. 

Gomersenda dreams of expanding their business so it will generate more income necessary for their daily needs, and for the school expenses of her children.

In the future, she hopes to continue having a good business to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fish net

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 33-year-old woman from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is married with 5 young children; the oldest is 13 while the youngest is 2 years old, respectively. Her husband worked as a carpenter to support their family.

She sells load (mobile phone credits) to customers who are Smart and Talk 'N Text subscribers to help augment the income of their household. Her business started quite a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to purchase more load to sell. This is very helpful in improving her business to gain higher income so she can purchase food for the family and pay school expenses.

In the future, Maricel hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more load (mobile phone credits) to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is widowed with six children. Carolina is 69 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.

Carolina sells a variety of goods to earn a living and has had this business for three years.  Each month, she earns PHP 1,900 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Carolina has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Carolina hope to improve her general living conditions.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Diodoro

texts.en:
Diodoro is 64 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan, Tudela, Philippines. He is married with five children. 

Diodoro works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for 40 years. He has requested a loan to purchase two rolls of fish nets and other materials used for fishing.

Diodoro has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Diodoro hopes to immediately support his family members.

loans.use: to purchase two rolls of fish nets and other materials used for fishing

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is widowed with six children.  She is 80-years-old and lives in Dela Paz,Clarin,Philippines.

Dionesia is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 10 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase five sacks of complete fertilizers.

Dionesia has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, she hopes to immediately support her family members.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of complete fertilizers

loans.name: Mary- Ann

texts.en:
Mary- Ann is studying for a BS in Information Technology at MU Oroqueita City. Mary- Ann joined Gata Daku MPC and she used her previous loan in paying her first semester tuition fees.

Recently she took another loan to pay her school tuition fees for the second semester. She is hopeful of finding a job after finishing her studies to be able to support the needs of her parents and to have a better future of her own.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees for the second semester
